name: Maymont
address: 1700 Hampton St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: Clean, green and very well maintained. Italian garden, Japanese garden, Nature center and wild life experience makes the visit here filled with fun for all age groups. Mansion is great. Kids would love exploring nature up and close here. Not sure if there is a bicycle path here.

One of the best free attractions in Richmond. Great place for a picnic or to walk around and see the Japanese garden. I love feeding the goats and sheep (remember to bring quarters). We had our daughters 1 year birthday party in the Stone Barn and it was awesome, they had horse and carriage rides for the kids. One of our go-to stops if the weather is nice.

The gardens are well maintained and the animals are taken care of too. Bring the family or someone special to enjoy this Richmond jewel. Be mindful, not all trails are paved so you're going to have trouble if your wheels/feet aren't off road and you want explore the grounds fully.

Lots of space to run around, beautiful gardens and historic house, and of course lots of animals to see. They have a whole petting zoo farm area AND a zoo area with local wildlife. They have eastern bison, a black bear, deer, and birds. Great place to take kids or go for a nice walk. I definitely haven't seen the whole place its full of secret areas.

We love Maymont! While it's not a traditional zoo, my son gets such a kick out of the animals. It's a great way to spend a couple of hours. Such a fun mixture of zoology, botany, and history. A great Richmond fixture for the whole family. Bring some quarters if your little ones like to feed animals!

name: Virginia Museum of Fine Arts
address: 200 N Arthur Ashe Blvd, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: We love this museum, it's not too big and there's always something interesting going on. Last month we came for the Edward Hopper exhibit, and this past weekend we came to see the existing museums exhibits (I really liked the American Art gallery, really beautiful ) and there was China Fest, for the Chinese lunar new year! Beautiful presentations by community dance and martial arts groups, programs for children as well ! Lots of kids! So much fun!

I love this place. I do find it a bit confusing to walk through, but there are many docents available to help. I bought tickets for the Edward Hopper exhibit yesterday and the woman at Visitor Services was so kind & helpful - set the tone for a wonderful visit!

There are many clean restrooms and a beautiful museum store. The entire place is so calming and makes for a great any day activity- alone or with a group.

Wonderful museum with beautifully curated exhibits covering a wide range of fine arts. The recent Hopper show was spectacularly presented. The museum staff here is the most knowledgeable, welcoming and helpful I have ever encountered. And let's not forget Amuse, the VMFA's world-class restaurant -- wonderful cuisine, cocktails, and wine list, plus awesome servers and staff.

Excellent Location. Cool and different artwork that caught my eye in all sorts of mediums. If you love art I spent 4 hours here and didn't even go over the additional exhibit they had at the time. Clean and relaxing as well.
What a great collection in a wonderful building. They really have one of everything here. This special exhibition space was generously proportioned so you had plenty of room to see all the art.

name: Science Museum of Virginia
address: 2500 W Broad St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: We took the kids here and this is by far the best science center I have ever been too. The kids had so much fun playing around and learning. I would have to say one of my favorite parts were playing air hockey with a robot, probably the nearest thing I've ever done. I would love yo go back. They do offer military discount, free for the active duty member and a dollar off for their dependents. We really enjoyed our day here and would love to go back. We traveled 2 hours to get here and it was well worth the trip.

Very nice place for kids in the 5-12 year range. After the spectacular entrance, we could see the magical SR71 stealth aircraft. Very good decision by the museum folks to move it inside. They have live animal exhibits, which is cool. There are folks who could answer any questions you might have, which is very good. Kids loved the science challenges. There are nice exhibits about current day problems such as plastic, pollution, etc which are so relevant and useful for everyone to know.

Wonderful science museum with a great, ever-changing collection of exhibits and hands-on activities. We especially loved the live dissection of a cow's eye! The only challenge of visiting the museum is the limited parking, though there are lots on the side off Broad and you can park in front of the children's museum next door. Definitely worth a visit or membership, especially if you have children!

An extremely fun and informative museum for individuals of all ages. The exhibits here are time-honored and exciting. Staff is very knowledgeable and friendly, especially with children. If you're looking for a fun place to take the kids on a Saturday afternoon, this is the place.

Great museum with lots of hands on activities to keep children engaged. The special event space is large and they always have great exhibits in there as well. I also appreciated the live cooking events that they do. I will say that their Cafe is pretty lackluster. It is all microwave food and premade sandwiches. For the price and the number of people (four) they had working behind the 10ft long counter they could have actually prepared some food. Overall, though a great way to spend a day.

name: Virginia Holocaust Museum
address: 2000 E Cary St, Richmond, VA 23223, USA
reviews:
It’s FREE (As it should be)

The spiral bound tour guide is well laid out and easy to follow. 

It doesn’t take an entire day to go through (~2hr)

The Nuremberg trials room full scale replica at the end is simply stunning. 

Possible next upgrade: an app or audio guide version of the tour. The app would also be an easy giving portal.

This museum is a very historic place. It will make you very emotional. As a wedding and event planner their auditorium is the perfect place for a reception. The view from upstairs overlooking the dinning area can be breathtaking if decorated right. We had the opportunity to do two event here. The staff is friendly and very accommodating. The museum itself is very clean. The caterer need warming towers as there is no kitchen and a limited food prep area

My husband and I spent two hours at the museum but didn't finish so we had to return the next day. It is pretty incredible. We were surprised by the detailed information and authenticity of the materials that were displayed, as well as the connection to those who survived the the holocaust then relocated to Richland. This free museum is a treasure.
Awesome experience, very humbling..... I didn't take any pictures. Wouldn't recommend for younger children because of content and there is a lot of reading and they would get bored very quickly.
Well told story, much information and many photos. Hard to take in sometimes- definitely takes 2 hrs or more depending on how much you read.

name: The Edgar Allan Poe Museum
address: 1914 E Main St, Richmond, VA 23223, USA
reviews: A very nice small museum! I'm sure it's lovely in the spring time with all the different plants. I would say you need to have an interest in Poe to visit as you will learn A LOT about him and his life. My visit was fun until the place swarmed with secret service.

I love that there are different buildings to self navigate through. Very cool sit down library with local raven art on the walls. Cute resident cats, nice staff, and lots of interesting things about Edgar A. Poe to learn here.

If you love history and poetry. Especially American Poetry written by Edgar Allen Poe this is the place for you....it's a quaint building but has a very eclectic collection of Poe relics, art, and history. Awesome place. Very cool spot. A must see.

Nice little stop for horror and mystery enthusiasts. There is a garden, small library, gift shop and museum on the property. It's not really a spooky thing, more educational. Die hard fans can leave a note or poem for Edgar. There is a shrine. But mostly it's a collection of historical items that have been saved from his houses or work before the buildings were destroyed.

Poetic. I have been a fan of Edgar Allan Poe since I was a little boy. I came to Richmond unaware of the museum here in his honor. What a treat!! First, folks, this is a right-sized museum. Not too big and not too small. Prices are very affordable and getting here from our downtown hotel was an easy but slightly long walk. Too many cool details to describe, but having a black cat strolling through the garden could only have been topped by a raven.

name: Libby Hill Park
address: 2801 E Franklin St, Richmond, VA 23223, USA
reviews: One of my favorite parks in Richmond. The views of the river and the city are amazing and the park is very well maintained. You see weddings often up here. There are plenty of benches and even a picnic table. And if you’re up for a workout, a great set of stairs! 😃
One of the best views of the sunset/skyline in Richmond. Great place to sit down and have a picnic if the weather is good. Parking is easier than expected.
Must see in Richmond a skip a way from downtown, great food trucks and great restaurants. Outdoor haven on nice days. Great place to take a dog or get a jog.
Great views of Richmond. Still has the old gas lamps. It is a popular workout spot due to the long set of stairs.
Nice views.  I stopped because I rode through this park on Zwift.  Nice place to just stroll and enjoy the views of Richmond.

name: Virginia State Capitol
address: 1000 Bank St, Richmond, VA 23218, USA
reviews: Beautiful building designed by Thomas Jefferson. So much history in this one location. Very knowledgeable and hospitable tour guides. Free tours on the hour. Loved seeing the original senate chambers and the statue of George Washington. The movie "Lincoln" was filmed here. Don't miss the Virginia Women's Monument outside.

Amazing Capitol. Awesome architecture and lots of history. The people who give the tours are very knowledgeable and fun to listen to. Me and my family absolutely loved the Virginia State Capitol Building would definitely go back to this state of the art building.

Fun time and educational. I skipped the tour and went on a Friday afternoon when it wasn't crowded. Employees were very helpful. The statues of Thomas Jefferson and George Washington are cool and the architecture (designed by Jefferson) is beautiful. There's also a nice park with statues outside to walk around in.
Great place to visit. Very historical. Amazing views. Great location to walk around Richmond and visit various locations. Beautiful architecture.

The actual tour of the Capitol is interesting in itself, but our docent could have been teaching a history class. So much knowledge! The majority of the time is spent in a few chambers so there is not a lot of walking. The information imparted there was of utmost interest and importance. Of course there is s gift shop which contains a variety of treasures. Our first stop in Richmond definitely encouraged us to explore more.

name: Agecroft Hall & Gardens
address: 4305 Sulgrave Rd, Richmond, VA 23221, USA
reviews: Beautiful home that truly takes you back in time. Your is very informative, though a bit long. Even in the winter the grounds are stunning, but must be truly magical in the spring/summer when in their full glory.

This is a amazing jump back in time to 1400s.  For $10 you will have a educational tour inside.  Stating with a short film.  A few opportunities to sit and rest while your guide describes life during the times in which this house was in England.  When the tour is done you will have the rest of your time to yourselves in the garden and grounds.  Well worth the trip.

I love agecroft but it has gotten to where all of their tours are identical.  You get exactly the same thing no matter which one you take.   Regular tour,  "behind thre scenes, " "architectural history, " whatever... all the same.

History buff place.  Only Elizabethan furnished English Manor in the U.S.
Guided tours only inside.  Lovely staff.  Gardens well worth seeing.
Such a beautiful manor. So glad it's still preserved.

name: Maggie L Walker National Historic
address: 600 N 2nd St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: The guide was super friendly and knowledgeable. The house is well preserved and it's like you're transported back in time. The tour is about an hour long and the kids can do activities in their junior park ranger booklet throughout it. Recommend this historical site to people looking to get their history fix in Richmond.

If you like museums and history....
Go visit Maggie L. Walker's home in Richmond, VA! The National Park Service (NPS) maintains this property and it was and is an eye-opener. I admit, i did not know who she was.....but i find myself telling EVERYONE i encounter about Maggie and her absolutely PHENOMENAL  life! 

I am now and forever will be a fan of Maggie L. Walker and her legacy!!

I enjoyed learning about her and all she has done!
Amazingly preserved home of an amazing woman!  Great tour.  Highly recommend!  And it's even free!
This was such a neat experience, lots of information. Amazing, I would love to go back again.

Visited the Maggie L Walker NHS as we try to visit all of the units in the park system. The staff here was extremely friendly and informative and, due to the low visitor count, we got a private tour of Maggie's home.

Would recommend visiting to learn more about this woman. Expect to spend 1-2 hours here if you do the tour

name: American Civil War Museum- Historic Tredegar
address: 480 Tredegar St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: A great place to visit for civil war memorabilia and artifacts. Stunning composure and presentation of materials with breathtaking audiovisual supplements makes for a singular experience that cannot be overlooked by any history buff. The expose on early American currency was particularly informative, including a wide selection of bills, both government and private bank notes. External exhibits were equally intriguing with the explanation of the workings of a civil war era iron mill. Outstanding in all aspects.

Really nice museum! Very informative! It is a little pricey and smaller than I thought but they do squeeze in a lot of information. Parking is validated with a ticket which is really nice. I brought my 5&9 year old honestly it was too much reading for them. They liked to look at the pictures and exhibits however went through the whole thing within minutes. My 5 year old was very bored.

Museum is well set up and has interactive electronic screens for each year of the war. There are also a few short videos that you can sit and watch throughout the exhibits. It is very visitor friendly and breaks the information up into digestible pieces. Highly recommend!

Excellent museum that I think expertly handles the intricacies of the Civil War. I learned a lot. Beautiful interior of the museum. Many multimedia presentations. Pretty cool. Probably ages 10 and up. But the 10yr old would have to be pretty interested in history.

Political Correctness run amok!

I'm not sure why the old Museum of the Confederacy was closed or why it merged into the Civil War Center to become what it is now, but it was a major disappointment.

The exhibits are well done and the facility is a wonderful effort of conservation and city redevelopment, however, they fail to pursue numerous area of this controversial area.  While they do deal with anti-war riots in New York and similar themes of the Confederacy, a lot was left out.  Now this isn't because the place is overfilled with material.  Nope...I'm estimating that only about 25% of the available floor space is occupied with exhibits.  The entry areas are massive and a waste of space.

Finally, in the gift shop, there are plenty of replicas of historic Union flags, as there should be, but no Confederate battle flags.  That says it all.

Don't waste your time here.

name: Hollywood Cemetery
address: 412 S Cherry St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: Enjoyed the afternoon to take a drive through. Very clean and well maintained cemetery. Was able to visit John Tyler and Jefferson Davis burial sites. The view towards the city and James river is well worth the visit.

A very nice and calm place to visit. If you love visiting cemeteries like I do, this place is a must. Very well kept up, a little easy to get lost in but it makes a great story. Just a magnificent place, great history.

Hollywood Cemetery is best know for being the burial location of  three people: James Monroe, John Tyler, and Jefferson Davis (and a whole bunch of confederate soldiers). 

However, locally, it best know for three ghost stories: The Little Girl and her Dog, the crying Pyramid, and the Richmond Vampire.  

Plus, to the dismay of the fine ground keepers at Hollywood Cemetery, it's almost a Richmond tradition to sneak into the cemetery at night. FYI: If you do get caught, you can be arrested and face huge fines.
Unique place to explore. We love walking with our dog. Beautiful views of the James River and city.

Beautiful, historical park like cemetery with graves of multiple Richmond notable figures & 2 US president’s.  Lovely views overlooking the James River.  Makes for a great urban hike.  For fans of the civil war it’s a must see as it has a large confederate section along with the grave of Jefferson Davis (not in the confederate section) & his family.  Many beautifully carved graves including faux bois style, figural, & obelisks.  A must see for native Richmonders & visitors alike

name: The Valentine
address: 1015 E Clay St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: This Museum was a great experience. There was a good gift shop inside with a good selection. There was over 100,000 items out on exhibit here. They are constantly updating the exhibits. The staff is extremely friendly and has a great deal of knowledge that they share with you if you have any questions. They exhibits are presented in a very elegant way. This Museum encompasses three buildings on this street.

I Zenia really had a wonderful time last night. It felt like I was invited to an awards program to receive a trophy., walking on the RED CARPET,  yea, yea, and the award i receive was a place on the wall in the Valentine's Museum.  
 it was like a fairy tail dream. but, hey it was real. with all my family,  and other winning recipients.  On the wall will all my WARRIORS
The Valentine museum is a great experience. You’ll learn about “meat juice” and great elements of what makes Richmond unique and its rich history. Don’t miss the house tour!

I have visited this museum several times. I really enjoyed the variety of Richmond & US history and present day stories that were provided. When I went last, the Miller and Rhoads clock was proudly displayed above the stair well that descended to the basement-like floor; that was something very special to see since my grandparents loved the store. I was also given a tour where our group was allowed to hold old, historically-important books, such as ones belonging to/read by Patrick Henry. That was very fun; I am an avid reader and love history. The museum has a creative mindset with their exhibits, there was not just one area of focus in history, the range was lovely. I reccomend this museum to be visited by adults or older children, the younger ones might not be interested in what they have to offer.
What beautiful buildings on a really cool street!

name: T. Tyler Potterfield Memorial Bridge
address: T Tyler Potterfield Memorial Bridge, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: Great bridge with great views and feeling of nature plus historical stories that the bridge has experienced and engraved on top of the bridge. You can feel the times of history and the emotions of the people involved through the addresses along the bridge. Well done.
Outstanding addition to James River park system. Great views and has really expanded public access.  Cool historical markers and quotes as well.

Gorgeous landscape of Richmond. I come to Richmond every week for work and I think this maybe the highlight of coming here. Such a gorgeous place to run, walk or just get away. 

I had a hard time finding the parking for this as the GPS kept stopping on the highway bridge. So I googled the climbers parking lot and there’s a path that takes you to the walking bridge and overlook. 

A must while your in Richmond for a big chunk of their history and natural beauty!

Great views of the city and the river! Bring sunglasses when it's sunny out, the metal decking can get blindingly bright. If you're running, pick your feet up, the decking has some joints that stick up ever so slightly - just enough to cause you to trip! 

Park on the north side of the river near Tredegar St and Brown's Island Way or on the south side of the river on Railroad Ave next to SunTrust.
Amazing natural pedestrian bridge with historical views. Well maintained and wide enough for large groups.

name: Capitol square
address: 1000 Bank St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: Paid a visit to the Capital to see the new Virginian women's monument - Voices From the Garden.  Though still in progress, the 7 out of 12 planned statues are very expertly crafted and worth the trip to see.  Surprisingly diminutive in size, the statues are realistically crafted and pleasantly life size. The memorial lacks information and context at this time.  There are no plaques nor hint of who the women are on display. So it's necessary to Google and learn who the figures are and who's to come. Not really a problem. All the more reason to pause and enjoy.

An amazing building and place full of history and history being made. Take a tour and explore were the oldest continuous legislative body sits in session and the awe inspiring architecture of Thomas Jefferson. The tour guides are terrific and take you through the unique history of Virginia and it's legislative body.

So much incredible history in and around this building. Touring the capitol and walking in the same chambers that Thomas Jefferson and George Washington did was surreal. Free hourly tours and such kind hospitality from the guides.

We took the free tour of the Capitol on a Sunday when we had friends in town visiting. The tour provides a good mix of information about the architecture and history of the Capitol building - beginning with Thomas Jefferson's role in its creation. Also, how the construction of Virginia's Capitol building influenced subsequent design choices in Washington,  D.C. and government buildings throughout the country.  The tour includes entry to the house chambers. We really enjoyed the tour and the expertise of our guide.
Historic building, lots of shade outside for those hot days, fountain, brick walkways, and underneath it all the visitor's entrance (with a delightfully air-conditioned inside).

name: Virginia Museum of History & Culture
address: 428 N Arthur Ashe Blvd, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: I feel a little torn, I enjoyed the museum but I expect there to be more.  A good exhibit on the lasting, personal impact of slavery and a walk through of Virginia's history we're the only things to see. They were both done well, but I was looking for more. Exhibits seem to skip forward a lot: i.e. Jamestown, Revolution, Civil War... With very little discussion about what happened in between. It's good, but I expected more -- most of the museum's space seems to be given to an  event hall and library.

A good overview of the state. They should keep the exhibition of African-American history in the Commonwealth on permanent display. Still has some Confederate displays from their time as the Confederate Museum.

Everyone needs to visit this place and get educated. Anyone who visits this place and then still thinks anything about the Confederacy should be celebrated, glorified and honored is a kook. The Charlie Brown exhibit was awesome!
They provides a full view of history, and done a good job to lay the history out in that space. They incorporates the both the original sense of history and the contemporary progressive ideas.

I am very glad to visit this museum in Richmond.  The exhibits were put together very well and believe me, it's a lot to digest, especially The Story of Virginia.  One of the temporary exhibits that was available (the last day will be the 21st) is Fresh Murals, which showcases paintings from local artists.  All I can say they will start conversations on Virginia's past and how far we can move toward the future.  Pictures below will be from all the artists.  Enjoy.

name: Virginia War Memorial
address: 621 S Belvidere St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: Absolutely beautiful memorial! They did such an excellent job creating this place. Inside is a little museum full of collections of uniforms and weapons from the different wars. They also have videos available of interviews of veterans from Virginia from each war. Best part was the 3D photographs. They were stunning my kids really enjoyed their visit.
Really great place to learn about duty, honor and the sacrifice that many native Virginians exhibited during our Nation's battles.

11/20 - I had a field trip here and it was great. The movie 4d movie was my favorite part. And also to the person who died on 11/19 May he Rest In Peace he helped out country and we can’t pay enough Thank you.
This place is very well maintained and quiet. It is a beautiful tribute to Virginia's fallen heroes.
Very nice facility. I was there to start their new boilers.

name: Children's Museum of Richmond
address: 2626 W Broad St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: My friend and I both took our 2 year old boys. They both loved and enjoyed this experience. There's never a dull moment especially with their short attention spans. There's so much to do even if they do lose the attention of one thing they're able to go find something real fast. It helps their developing skills and the staff is always wonderful. I really wish I had a membership here so that my son would be able to enjoy this more my friend and I both took our two year old boys. They both loved and enjoyed this experience. there's never a dull moment especially with their short attention span. there's so much to do even if they do lose the attention of one thing they're able to go find something real fast. it helps her developing skills and the staff is always wonderful. I really wish I had a membership here so that my son would be able to enjoy this more as a single mom my don't have. But they do have a deal where every second Friday is only a dollar and those are the days I love the most.

Always alot to do, we usually spend 3-4 hours here. On the weekends they usually have a theme and many activities for the kids. The cost is inexpensive and you get more than your monies worth. The staff is friendly and always willing to help and include your children in activities going on.
Clean, spacious and educative. Fun place for kids to play and learn. Arts and craft area is a good spot for young and adults to learn and bond. Amazing place to visit any season of the year.

We had a great time. The age 3 and under section has been completely redone and today was the first day it was open so we were the first group to use it. It was also decorated for Christmas and had an exhibit section with tiny rooms we could enter decorated and dedicated to different holidays celebrated this time of year all over the world.
We went during the holiday season and they had different holidays for cultures across the world. Very informative for children. Helps them learn that Christmas is not the only holiday celebrated.

name: Robert E Lee Memorial
address: Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews:
“We Are Fighting for Independence, Not Slavery”. - Jefferson Davis President of the Confederacy to Edward Kirk

“Slavery is a political evil in every country.” -Robert E Lee

“I am rejoiced that slavery is abolished. I believe it will be greatly for the interests of the South. So fully am I satisfied of this, as regards Virginia especially, that I would cheerfully have lost all I have lost by the war, and have suffered all I have suffered, to have this object attained.” - Robert E Lee

“I have always been in favor of Emancipation.” - Robert E Lee 

Robert E Lee- Son of a Revolutionary war veteran, graduate of West Point, veteran of the Mexican American war, defender of Virginia, anti slavery, and president of a university. 

A great family man that everyone can admire.

The whole Monument Ave is a nice walk or drive, a bunch of pretty houses, and some cool monuments, if that's your thing. Not really mine. Much pretty in spring or fall, when the trees are full & blooming

Very beautiful. A sobering reminder of the lives lost during the civil war and very humbling to see. Unfortunately due to newly proposed legislation, statues and monuments such as this one may not be around much longer. So if you want to see it I would go see it soon. I saw the R.E.LEE monument in New Orleans before they tore it down. Saddening however I'm glad I was able to see it.
Beautiful street to stroll and learn some history.
Amazing monument. Beautifully setup

name: Maymont Nature Center
address: 2201 Shields Lake Dr, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: Small but awesome nature center with live fish, turtles, snakes, alligators, seahorses, river otters, and more. It's beautiful inside and very well arranged and presented. The staff are friendly. There is a discovery center with animal skeletons, pelts, shells, and hands-on activities in this nature center as well. It's also a great place to have a birthday, as you get a private room and full access to the discovery and nature centers. Worth the price of admission.

One of our favorite places in Richmond. It's quiet, clean, beautiful landscape and some very cool animal rescues including two bald eagles and a bear! Who knew there were Bison in the heart of Richmond?😜

I'm not sure exactly what words I would use to describe this place public park Mansion gathering spaces and just some beautiful spaces to walk around. there are so many different parts to this place it's good to look ahead to know what exactly you want to check out. Highly recommended. I wish you lived around here to come back many many times.

The nature center itself is closed until April 2020. However, there are still several animals you can see outside walking around (fox, birds of prey, black bear) which was really nice. It seemed like a really great area to walk around overall and they have a farm animal section as well.

Visited this park on May 2018. Beautiful, green, clean park. You can see farm animals, birds, wild cat, etc. It has a beautiful Japanese garden. My kids enjoyed the time there. They can play, run, roll down and enjoying ice cream over there!

name: G-Force Karts
address: 800 E Laburnum Ave Gate 2, Richmond, VA 23222, USA
reviews: First time here and had a blast.  I brought my son with me and we took fastest of the day after he beat me a few times I ended up with a fast kart on our last race and  took the fastest of the day back.  We enjoyed the hospitality of the employees also which they answered any of our questions.  Excited for our next visit soon.  Thank you for the fun

Fun place to go Karting, they have all the safety gear including neck braces and clean head wraps. We had a blast! Staff is Knowledgeable and helped everyone feel safe. We will come back to race again soon!

The sales people here are very cool but they probably repeat the same things to everyone so they spoke rather fast about the rules.  The food bar was awesome and there is a large arcade room on the other side.  Due to rushing to get on the track I wasn’t able to take many pictures of the track but this place is very fun I heard this location will be closing soon and they are moving to the Richmond Raceway.  I hope they open up an outdoor track soon.  I think it would also be cool if they added a mini golf action too.
Awesome experience. Been a while since I went go karting. Definitely doing it again. They made the prep very simple and easy. Staff is friendly and caring.
Had a blast with my family. Laser Tag and Karts. Loved it. Great staff. We were short a player and they stepped in to fill in. Awesome!

name: Riverfront Canal Cruises
address: 139 Virginia St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews:
The boat operator did a terrific job explaining the history of the canal and its construction. Also, I learned a lot about the history of Richmond, Virginia during the boat operator's talk.  I highly recommend this to anyone who loves learning about history, and especially for kids who are learning about American history in school. 

Canal tour is 40 minutes and it is in located downtown on the Canal Walk. Perfect location to include it in a day of sightseeing of Richmond's numerous attractions.

I did the walking tour of the area. I inquired and got great information from the ticket booth operator about the rates, route, and time of departure. The boat departs every hour on the hour, and rates seemed very reasonable. Due to time restraints I was not able to do the boat tour, but would definitely  schedule on my next trip.

Nice little tour to check out if you're in the area. Our tour guide Cotton was a nice guy and made sure we had a great time while learning the history of Richmond. Very interesting tour worth checking it out. $10 bucks a person.

Forty five inexpensive minutes of fun and Virginia history education on the route designed by the Father of the USA himself: George Washington! Our steersman, " Cotton", was skilled and engaging.  The boat only draws a foot of water,  and the canal for the most part is three feet deep,  but you will be shown the life preservers. Have fun!

I am a Native Richmond Resident and I was in awe of the Beauty it had. As a child I watched as they perfected this but time got away from me and I never thought to frequent there. It took my breath away to hear about the history of my town but it made me prouder to be able to say I was born there. I'm taking my family back soon so they can witness the beauty of this tour.

name: Black History Museum and Cultural Center of Virginia
address: 122 W Leigh St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: Interesting exhibits. Whole top floor dedicated to Sally Hemmings/Thomas Jefferson story. My guess is that the top floor will always be used for the featured exhibit, which happened to o be about them. Would love to see more Richmond history. Interactive screens were a nice use of technology.

Really enjoyed touring the BHM.  The facility is modern, spacious and well laid out.  Having a volunteer guide walk us thru the museum, helping us to know what's available in each of the galleries was extremely helpful. Our guide was very good at prodding us w contextual questions. Like the paradox of TJefferson who wrote "that all men were created equal" yet built and sustained his farm at Monticello by maintaining 607 slaves. By comparison, the Virginia Museum of History and Culture currently has an exhibition: "Determined: 400 Years of African American Struggle for Equality". This is excellent! I only wished BHM would have half of the content and vision of that temporary exhibit. VA's history is steeped in the injustice and struggle for African-Americans' equality.  I predict BHM would grow in prominence by better telling the black experience for emerging, waking generations if told from a VA perspective.

You must go the history is displayed abundantly! I'm a senior citizen and there were things I saw up close and personal that made me cry inside. The history is real. I shall  visit again with my grandson.
Our trip here was AWESOME.  The guides took the time to deliver all of their information on a 2nd  grade level.  Our students and the adults thoroughly enjoyed this field trip.

This museum is small but mighty. There are so many amazing stories from black history that we did not learn in school, and many took place right here in Virginia. The permanent exhibit here is wonderful. Lots to learn from the large touchscreen in the hallway.  I've also seen some wonderful rotating exhibits come through on the second floor. If you've never been here, you'll want to check it out.

name: Pony Pasture Parking Area
address: 7310 Riverside Dr, Richmond, VA 23225, USA
reviews:
Gorgeous! The area was very crowded today because the weather was beautiful! Go on a day that is not as crowded and you'll find multiple areas to go for a swim, kayak/canoe or just play in the water.

We left shortly after the cop yelled, "EVERYONE WHO IS PARKED IN THE STREET WILL BE TOWED!!" 😃

Went on a Tuesday so it wasn't crowded. If you go on the weekends, get there early so you don't have to fight for parking. Very fun place to relax and swim. I would recommend swimming shoes for grip on the rocks

Super river views. Great wading opportunities when the river is low. Wooded trails along the river. Good picnic spots. Restrooms near parking area. River provides opportunities for fishing, kayaking and canoeing.
I love coming here to swim in the summer. Nice place to hang out on the rocks, take the kids and the pups. Parking can get full later in the day after noon.

Nice place to cool off.  Water is a nice temperature to cool off in.  I would have given a 5 but there a lot of rude people.  We were literally on the smallest rock and a group of 15 people came and took it over.  Set up their bbq 3 feet from us which killed the whole point of trying to cool off.  It's a fun place for kids to enjoy the river and explore.  Bring food and something to sit on and enjoy.

name: Canal Walk
address: 1512 Canal Walk, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: Located along the James River in downtown Richmond Virginia. The Canal Walk is surrounded by beautiful views of the James River and the city. Two islands are accessible from the Canal Walk. Brown's Island and Belle Isle. Brown's Island is grass and sidewalk covered and great for public outdoor events and concerts. Belle Isle is tree covered, surrounded by large boulders, with the James River flowing around and over the rocky terrain that encircles it. A wide walking and biking trail follows the river around the island in a circle. Belle Isle is accessible by a footbridge that is a short walk from Brown's Island. A sure bet for an enjoyable outdoor adventure for friends, family, or anyone. A+

Really great place to get walking in.. walk it to the pipeline bridge and visit Brown Island pedestrian bridge near by. If you're up for it go to the Belle Isle pedestrian bridge too. All are right there together and great walks

We discovered the Canal Walk going to and from the folk festival. It was a delight and pleasurable walk.  Lots to look at and take in from the natural setting to free form art work and graffiti. Great for walking or bike riding.  I will say, having walked it at night, that most of the lights were out, which doesn't compliment the rest of the walk.
My first time walking this tour. Between the mix of architecture, especially in the banking district and the natural beauty of the river and forestry at play, makes for an awe inspiring scenic tour.

I lived here for years! Why have I never taken this walk?! I moved out of state a decade+ ago only to visit over the 2018 winter holidays and find this gem. It's a wonderful activity to do with family and friends. The sights are beautiful. Along the canal there are historical landmarks, rock climbing, biking/walking trails, photography ops, and fresh air. It's a clean walk and was very fun with my family. We had a two year old with us too and it was a great sensory experience for him.

name: Confederate Pyramid
address: Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: Cool pyramid!  Great tribute to women
Beautiful monument, must see.
History of our country

A large haunting tomb containing the remains of Confederate Soldiers who died in the Civil War. The craftsmanship isn’t something to behold and appears more as a tall pile of stones than a organized structure.
Spectacular historical monument in the middle of an important historical cemetery you should go

name: Richmond National Battlefield Park - Chimborazo Medical Museum
address: 3215 E Broad St, Richmond, VA 23223, USA
reviews: Nice, small park.  There is a 15 minute movie about Chimborazo, a room with artifacts from the Connie was and a diarama with the hospital's layout.  The staff are extremely friendly.

The museum is small but interesting. Learned much about medical care of the civil war . 
The view from the hill is amazing and you can see for miles. The homes in the neighborhood are well maintained and we enjoyed the drive there.
Get to learn as much about history as possible. Kids need to learn it. Great old neighborhood

It’s a nice park with great views. The medical museum is really interesting. It’s packed with stuff and well laid out with lots of information. The people that work there are very nice and know a lot. It gives you an appreciation for what they went through in the Civil War and definitely makes you grateful for modern medicine.

I recently discovered that my great great great uncle died here from disease. I read about the hospital and thought I would go visit it one day. Had to go to Richmond and just happened to pass this and HAD to stop. I plan to come back with my sister and actually see and learn the full history. I look forward to adding to this review. (Government shutdown was in full force so I couldn't go in)

name: VCU Institute for Contemporary Art
address: 601 W Broad St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: I was incredibly excited to visit the Institute for Contemporary Art.  I heard so much about it before visiting Richard for the first time, and the incredible installations they feature.  It was to my great surprise my trip fell on a weekend of an opening.  My night was topped off by meeting intriguing Artist, Lecturers and Public Figures.  The installations and films were brilliant! The staff was as contemporary and artful as the institute itself.  There are cocktails and snacks at the bar to make  sure your night is complete.  I’ll be back VCU! XOXO Lorenzo
Great building architecturally. Exhibitions were on point as well. Gift shop had an amazing collection of publications that are hard to come by outside of nyc. (Shot-out to Precog mag)

Beautiful new building with lovely, interesting architecture on the outside and provocative modern art on the inside. You will find three large art galleries, and large auditorium, an outside terrace, lockers and coat storage, plenty of seating inside and out, and Elwood Thompson's Cafe (they serve beer!). Plenty to see, hear, and touch. All for free! It really is a beautiful installation, and we look forward to seeing the collections as they are installed. Definitely worth checking out, and a wonderful addition to the already great museum scene in Richmond.

Beautiful architecture. I like seeing new museums in Richmond that showcase modern pieces of art from around the world. Considering it’s absolutely free, it’s worth a trip. My family and I scratched our heads a lot throughout the Hedges, Ledges, Edges exhibit... was this artwork too conceptual for us? It felt sparse but I get that that’s probably what they were after.

Awesome addition to The neighborhood.  Architecture is cool and vibrant.  The layout of the museum is nice, but I don't think they use it to their advantage.  I was not impressed with the exhibits on display.  We thought the lobby was more interesting!

name: William Byrd Park
address: 600 S Arthur Ashe Blvd, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: Went jogging here on a crisp morning.  Lovely trail.
Its a little park nice for families or a stroll

It's a beautiful park with several beautiful, scenic areas that are great for walking or maybe a picnic.  The VITA trail is one mile and has different fitness stations along the way. It is a scenic trail with even terrain. I enjoy taking my son out on the trail in his stroller. Also what's nice about the park is it is surrounded by some beautiful lakes. Fountain Lake is very pretty. It is a half mile around and has benches all along the perimeter in case you just want to sit and take in the scenery. Also, Fountain Lake is the only spot in the area that I have found that has a building with restrooms. Swan Lake is stunning, but the sidewalk does tend to be dirty on account of the birds. Definitely worth visiting though. Swan Lake is serene. Byrd Park also has other neat areas to visit, such as the Virginia War Memorial and the Dogwood Dell Amphitheater (which I believe hosts concerts during the summer).  Overall, I am a huge fan of Byrd Park. It is family friendly, great for walks, playing, or just sitting and taking in the beautiful scenery!
I recently discovered the vita course here and it's a 3.8 mile return trip from my front door. Great power walk and fitness trail for anyone to go at their own pace. A wonderful find.
A nice park where I occasionally do my weekend run. Lots of ducks and geese around. Some sketchy types pop up once in a while, but the area seems safe enough.

name: Wilton House Museum
address: 215 S Wilton Rd, Richmond, VA 23226, USA
reviews: It was late in the day (awhile back) and my daughter and I were sightseeing so the sign for this place caught our attention. The tour guide was very willing to show us about and incredibly knowledgeable. The house is very interesting even though it is not in it's original location or set up in it's original grandeur. The grounds needs lots of work, but if you like architecture and history, then it is worth a visit.
Absolutely beautiful. We had our wedding here and the grounds were perfect. The Museum is very interesting and the staff is very knowledgeable.
Beautiful House not too many people
Very nice historical place to visit with plenty of photo opportunities.
The docent was really nice and welcoming. I went with a group and she was very flexible and patient, and willing to answer questions. Parking is a little difficult.

name: Richmond National Battlefield Park
address: 470 Tredegar St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: Well maintained visitor center and exhibits. Surrounding area is also great to take a stroll. Easy access to Belle Isle. Free parking for an hour in the parking lot if validated. Otherwise you can park in the Belle Isle lot which is usually filled up. I'll suggest about two hours to experience this place fully.

This museum was very informative, quit interesting and sad. I definitely recommend it if you had problems understanding history in school or just didn't have a teacher that brought it to life for you. Lots of trinkets, letters and clothing samples. Go.

American History is usually my forte. Learning about it in history books and even in historical television reenactments / movies doesn't do too much to explain how it all went down. It was nice to find this museum on a road trip to Richmond, VA. After a search on Google Maps and TripAdvisor, I decided to spend the afternoon along the James River and visit the Richmond National Battlefield Park on a nice Tuesday afternoon.
Awesome History Lessons & Time With My Family.
Beautiful place.

name: Ancarrow's Landing
address: 1200 Brander St, Richmond, VA 23224, USA
reviews: Nice place needs a little bit of daily cleaning and path clearing but it is the middle of the hit summer so I kinda understand. Think it would be even nicer during cooler weather to visit. Watch out for the poison ivy

The water level is said to be around 12.6 , Tuesday morning. I took these pictures around 4:15pm Tuesday. The damage to property and amount of debris is crazy. The fast pace of the river was just mind blowing, and dangerous... Please use caution when stopping and taking pictures.
Great place to take my kid on a nature walk. It IS long, though.
Nice little park off the beaten path right up against the James River. Great walking trails including the end of the historic Richmond slave trial. Plenty of parking and never too busy.

Nice hike on a cold day, but on a warmer day the smell might be off putting from the nearby sewage treatment plant (hence the nickname the poop loop).  Trails are definitely designed more for bikers than hikers, but they do have them designated so you’re not competing for trail space with the bikers & all of the trails get equal wear & tear.

name: Maymont Japanese Garden
address: N Bank Trail, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: It's a fantastic place to visit, a must see in Richmond! You can spend hours in the gardens, there's an animal park that kids would love. If you have the time take a tour of the house too, its pretty neat. I visited in February, and will definitely be going back in the spring when it is in full bloom!

I was married here Halloween 2019. The staff that worked with us were amazing. They made the wedding process so much easier and I will be forever grateful for their kindness and helpfulness. This is a beautiful area to visit and I recommend it to everyone.

I love this place.  The Japanese garden is beautiful. In November, Maymont Park organizes an event every year with lights at night.  It's worth the detour !  The lights highlight this beautiful garden.  I recommend this place.  Take out your cameras or smartphone, you will not regret.

What a gem! It is beautiful even in winter. Get a map of the grounds to guide your walk. There are many paved paths, shade trees, gazebos,  interesting botanicals. On a sunny, mild (50F) we walked about four miles there, and loved it.
It's beautiful and serene. Good for people of all ages. You can walk, rest, click pictures, play, celebrate here.

name: Putt-Putt Fun Center
address: 7901 Midlothian Turnpike, Richmond, VA 23235, USA
reviews: We went the weekend before school started. The kids have seen this place from the car and always wanted to go so we finally did and we weren't disappointed. We all got on the go carts and bumper boats, played putt-putt, had pizza for dinner, we ended the trip playing arcade games inside. It was a lot of fun and we will definitely be going back. They have good deals for families, outdoor activities with pizza and drink and indoor for games, making it a little more affordable. We had as much fun as the kids did.

I have been here several times from childhood to adulthood.  It is one of the few entertainment places for kids that has outstood the test of time.  I take my children here periodically.  This particular time, we only did golf; however they have a decent arcade inside.  Outside is the golf, water boats and go-karts, all of which we have enjoyed at one time or another. You have 3 courses to choose from for golf.  We chose the first course with 18 holes of varying difficulty but just plain fun family activity.  I did notice there was a little trash and no water in the exhibit which could've taken it to the next level if corrected.  I also think there should be a better barrier around the bottom of the gate that encloses the golf area; I saw numerous people losing balls, by putting them into the parking lot accidentally.  I did like that there benches throughout so you could sit while the next person is putting and there were stations to write on your scorecards. We purchased a 12 attraction ticket for $60 so we will be back when it gets warmer for the water boats and go-karts.
Been coming here since I was a kid, now bringing my daughter here to spend some weekend fun time.

I used to come here when I was a kid. I loved it then and it still has it. The games and go-karts still satisfy the kiddos. Also nice the tickets go back to your game card so no keeping up with all that.
A great date night spot, and a good family day out spot as well.

name: Black Heath Meadery
address: 1313 Altamont Ave, Richmond, VA 23230, USA
reviews: If you like mead, go here. Go here right meow. Also, if you like The Dude, they have The Big Lebowski glasses for merch.
The absolute friendliest staff! What a wonderful remodel, and the mead is also great. Prices are a bit high, but it's all hand made, and locally sourced.
Dog friendly. Cozy  great atmosphere. Very friendly people. Bill thank you for the great hospitality!!! Out of towners will feel welcomed here.
This place is wonderful. Definitely get a flight to try out all the unique flavors they have to offer, and go back often because they are always changing!

👍👍👍👍👍 A 5 thumbs-up rating! The owner is nice and knowledgeable. And might I say very accommodating. I tasted their Mead at a favorite beer hall called "the answer" and the next morning wanted to acquire a bottle or two. They were not open but the owner met me there and welcome me in. Customer service from the door through the bottle!

name: The Branch Museum of Architecture and Design
address: 2501 Monument Ave, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: Beautiful architecture.  Would've been neat to see it furnished in a way somewhat similar to the way it might've been originally.  Tour guide didn't seem to be extremely knowledgeable.  Wish more rooms were open.  Would be a great place to host special events.

The architecture and design within the building was interesting. However I was expecting a bit more. There could have been more explaining the architecture throughout the building. Some more interior designing would've allowed experiencing the architecture in innovative ways. The gallery was being used to display the entrants of a children's design completion. Actually that was great. I love seeing community involvement.
 I would say don't write it off. The Branch is shooting signs that there is reconstruction and remodeling occurring. It should warrant a visit when spending time visiting there local museums.
We could only see the first floor.  It is an amazing, huge tudor inspired home with an  architectural pedigree. It's cool.  We wanted to see more of it.
Beautiful house. Disappointed only can view the first floor. Other than setting first floor, no decorations or period furniture.
It was a nice old house but you only get to see the fist floor and it’s absolutely empty.  Would be a nice place for a catered event though.

name: The Richmond Railroad Museum
address: 102 Hull St, Richmond, VA 23224, USA
reviews:
We came for a train day event so it was really fun for the little ones riding and jumping the bouncy train, there are also free face paint and balloon twists.
Even the adults loved watching the miniature trains and railroads in the museum.
You get a guided tour by one of the  volunteers and get to climb on some train cars. Definitely place to visit
Great exhibits and knowledgeable staff. Great representation of Richmond rail history.

What a great place to find out some very interesting information about the railroads around Richmond. Staff is excellent and very knowledgeable about all thier exhibitions. The building itself has so much history in it and has been around for a long time. Who would ever know this small building would offer so much. Highly recommend to check this place out. 
Plus they are a part of a great organization that does train excursions in Dillwyn Virginia. Old Dominion Chapter of the National Railway Historical Society is a fantastic organization with a lot to offer. If you love trains check them out too.
Had a great time. Tremendous amount of History. Would recommend it. There's parking on the left side of the building.

name: St Paul's Episcopal Church
address: 815 E Grace St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: The Lenten weekly service is wonderful.  The luncheon is very nice and the volunteers are so special.  I highly recommend the cheese souffle!
Wonderfully rich community. Open and welcoming. Generous and caring.
Lenten Lunch today of cheese souffle and vegetable sides was most tasty, and of an appropriately modest size!  Kudos to the volunteer staff who prepared and served it!!

A truly lovely, and loving, church. Very engaging and welcoming. Visited to attend the funeral of S. Buford Scott and came away thinking how fortunate and blessed are it's congregants. Saint Paul's Episcopal is a true treasure... for its history and its architectural beauty, yes, but also for the good it does, the good it encourages, and the good it advances in the community that is RVA.
This is a wonderful church with some great history.

name: Chimborazo Park
address: 3215 E Broad St, Richmond, VA 23223, USA
reviews: Great little info center. Learned a lot about Confederate medical care. The views from the park of the James river valley were very expansive. Free admission. Great National Parks Service educational film.

I just love the view around the park and the area all together. There is another park very close by that I would visit, the view is also breathtaking. I would recommend this place if you want to go somewhere romantic, or show family and friends from out of town how beautiful Richmond is.

Large park with lots of gazebos and semi-hidden paths that take you up, down, and around. For older kids, this is a pretty cool park to explore because there are trails going down to other green spaces. For younger kids, there are no playgrounds (there are two nearby, but not in the park) and not much to do. Great for strolling around or walking the pets. Plenty of nice views from on high. After a good rain, bring your mud boots!
The park is lovely. Great overlook of the city. Nice place to walk or people watch

It's a well laid out, scenic simple park. They have a couple battle monuments and a couple of plaques commentating the civil war hospital there. Nice park, decent parking...  Great place to relax and take in the area.

name: Bryan Park
address: 4308 Hermitage Rd, Richmond, VA 23227, USA
reviews: The park was quite lovely today. Azeleas starting to do their thing and lots of trees in bloom. This park should be great place to walk and or bike, but too many people choose to ignore the leash law for their dogs. We were accosted by 2 large dogs today. They were friendly, thank goodness, but none the less they frightened my little Grandson. So if you are walking/biking you have to be on constant lookout for unleashed dogs. It's very disturbing.

Bryan park is one of Lakeside's finest features. It's huge, has one of the best disc golf courses in Virginia, and it's full of hidden treasures I dare not speak here. But spend some time walking around, you'll find little trail heads that lead you to interesting places. 

It is, however, sadly underfunded by the powers that be. There is a great group of volunteers and staff that work dutifully to keep it nice for the rest of us, but $$$ is needed to really bring the potential of Bryan Park out. I wish there were more to this place, but it's still a beauty unto itself.

I grew up going to this park. I lived right down the road from it for years and years. It's lost some of it's former glory, but it's still a really great place to walk the dogs or have a picnic. They've even got a kids play area now (which didn't exist when I was young. I'm jealous.).

Clear, paved running paths, a disc golf course and lots of green open spaces. Great place to walk the dog get a bit of exercise in. Just not on Saturday mornings. At least not if you desire any quiet whatsoever. Local soccer teams use the area for practice. Not complaining, just be aware there's a lot of soccer mom traffic that time of day and week.
Beautifully designed park offering so much for all of us who use it.  Great water to sit by, frisbee golf course, trails and my favorite Muscovy Duck !

name: Huguenot Flatwater - James River Park System
address: 8600 Southampton Rd, Richmond, VA 23235, USA
reviews: Gotta say. I live close to this one and if it weren't for the water I would barely call it a park. I really want something great to happen here but it would have to begin with a parking lot expansion. The areas under the bridge could be used for a volleyball court, playground, you name it. It could be amazing. Right now there is barely enough room to pass on the trail. Please add features!
Great paddle in Richmond. No power boats. Flatwater with little current at low water levels. Power upriver to Bosher Dam. Cruise back and enjoy the nature around. Plenty Osprey fishing today.
Pretty easy to find but not enough parking spaces. Had a ton of fun with water sports. Pretty clean and has porta potty there accessible.

I would say this was calm and relaxing, but we were at the rapids lol it was however very calm and relaxing. My children were happy and laughing. What more could you want when it's hot out. The day was beautiful. Please hold on to and watch your kids. 

The only reason I didnt give 5 stars is bc there isnt enough parking for the amount of people who go here. There is no place to bbq, and they should clear out some of the shrubbery for more open spaces. Overall, definitely going back. Peaceful.
A wonderful place to take the pups for aquatic activities, also if you're keen on fishing, or looking for a relaxing place to take a breath of air in the woods by the river

name: Great Shiplock Park
address: 2803 Dock St, Richmond, VA 23223, USA
reviews: Such a hidden treasure! A great place to come for some light hiking, fishing and relaxation. I definitely recommend this place for a beautiful picnic with a loved one., and make sure you enjoy the food trucks next door! Great little area!

This is a great place to stretch your legs and explore one of the many trails. There is a good variety of open areas and shade to suit the weather. The trails here are relatively flat without being boring. Come explore!

I start my walks here every time I need to walk my demons off. It starts to calm me. I often go there when I am near critical with my demons.   It always brings me a measure of peace. Then I start my walk. 

I love this park.
I enjoyed the paths that lead to a great spot by the water. Very quiet.

Great/easy river access. Now that I have a stroller and a million things to carry I look for the easier entry. I appreciate the beautiful view of the sunset that you get here and there's plenty of fishermen enjoying the site as well!

name: Pipeline Overlook
address: Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: Great experience. Narrow walkway so please be courteous to other people when they want to pass. This area is a popular attraction in summer, people get down off the walk and in the sandy beach beside the James River. Off path is some trash and homeless camps.. I've never had a problem with them when I visit. Would love to see some beach cleanup effort. Be cautious of snakes.. they are there. Take a picture and leave them be.

Great place to take a little hike. It used to be a lot cooler when more abandoned places were on the river bank and the hipsters didn’t know about this place but it’s still nice to check out if you can find a time when the people without jobs aren’t hanging out and doing whatever it is they do while not working 😂. Check it out and enjoy the photo ops and lovely sound of the river !
Cool. A little scary. Kinda dangerous. Careful with your car keys.
Pretty cool to see especially when the water is really moving through there
Very cool experience to be walking across the water!

name: Floodwall Park
address: Richmond, VA 23224, USA
reviews: It was a bit difficult to find but ended up being a great experience. The memorial bridge was my favorite...always good to reflect on history.

This place is amazing at night. My son is getting crazy if we visit here at night. this is well maintained trails. it is one of my absolute favorite views in Richmond and it's easy to visit and not crowded at all. Good place to go for the walk.

Great walk with the view of the city and James river. It may need some clean up with the abandoned factory and parking lot but it was a cool little adventure and it seems to be a great start of a running trail

I don't know what I did but won't pop up with you across the bridge or whatever the case may go to Rohnert Park have a good day enjoy yourself let me see what's going on you know it's just a city with the flood wall I don't understand that I'm going to get back to water money rains so that's a good thing you always nice to have a friend walk in the doors are made of concrete
Dramatically scenic spot ... if you're in the neighborhood, drop by.

name: Lewis Ginter Botanical Garden
address: 1800 Lakeside Ave, Richmond, VA 23228, USA
reviews: Gorgeous any month of the year and most importantly, year round interest. I went in January and still found new things in bloom and winter interest. Also more kid-friendly and interactive than I would think. Hit the kids area in the back, build a gnome home, and watch your kids playing like we did as kids in the woods while you enjoy the tranquility of the flowers and the calm (obviously I have young children).

Vising the festival of lights is a fun family activity. It's easy to get around and the atmosphere is very festive. Some years are better than others, but I still recommend going. Going a bit later in the evening will help you avoid the crowds. Buy your tickets online to make entry quick and easy. Small children may enjoy seeing the lights (for a little while) but there really isn't a whole lot for them to do.

Visited in December during a mild evening. Beautiful light display for the holiday. The library at this garden is incredible. I was really impressed with their seed sharing program - very organized. The gift shop is massive. If I lived locally, I would visit monthly!

Lewis Ginter is not only a beautiful location to visit for both locals and from out of town, but also a spectacular wedding venue. The staff are wonderfully helpful to both vendors and guests alike. I had the honor of photographing a client's wedding in the gardens during the spring and was blown away by how sweet and accommodating the workers and event staff were and my bride and groom had nothing but fantastic things to say about their experience as well. 10/10 will absolutely recommend the venue to future clients.

One of our family's favorite outings.  Absolutely breathtaking.  Every season had its own magic - never a missed opportunity to enjoy nature's bounties.  Awe inspiring and effortless exercise - don't even notice the mileage you put in out there, lol.  The kids don't even complain...

name: James River Park Pipeline Walkway
address: 310 S 14th St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: This is the best kept secret in Richmond! Love walking on the historical pipe and being right next to the river and hearing the rushing water, so freeing! And if you are really lucky a train will go over your head! ❤

Awesome place that's tucked away from the public. There are some rapids over here that are calming to watch and fun to ride, as well as a calmer area further down that's great for the whole family. It's a tight squeeze to get to any of the beaches, especially if you're there when other people are coming or going, but once you're there the place is just magical.
I lovely and picturesque beach and rocks. Don’t let the pipeline in the name fool you. If the blue herons don’t mind it, you shouldn’t either. No wheelchair access.

High adventure, walking tour around Riverfront Canal area led me to this area by accident.  I arrived with several people, I described what I was looking for. They confirmed the location. You won't find this long name spelled out. I walked the rails, didn't quite trust my balance over the Pipeline that crosses over to Brown's Island. I will return after some balance training, maybe.
Very cool little land mark. Walking ontop of the pipe can be slightly scary when the railings are gone but it's fun! Definitely worth a visit when you visit Richmond.

name: Three Lakes Park & Nature Center
address: 400 Sausiluta Dr, Richmond, VA 23227, USA
reviews: The nature center is awesome. It was so much better than I was expecting. There are a lot of different species of fish and turtles. The park is nice. We’ve had some team lunches here under the covered pavilions. The playgrounds are pretty much always crowded. There is a decent amount of parking.
Beautiful lake and conservatory for the family to enjoy. Lovely play equipment and picnic tables to have a meal with your loved ones. Had a great, relaxing day at this peaceful park.
Great park and accessible playground. Unfortunately the nature center is only ever open starting at noon, which is right during naptime for us. Would love to see it sometime.

Love this park. It has two playgrounds long walking trails. A public restroom. picnic shelters, plenty of parking, and lakes one huge one that you can fish off of a designated pier and the other one is full of wildlife and underwater life with a museum that has more detailed looks at nature and has hours from 12- like 4 ir 5. A great place to take kids.

My toddler and I love coming to visit Three Lakes Park, whether it be in the morning, afternoon, or evening. In the morning, we play on the 2 different large playgrounds and chase the geese. In the later part of the day, we will walk around the lakes, under the shady and cool trees. We enjoy visiting the nature center because we get to see a variety of fish, turtles, snakes and other animals.

name: Texas Beach
address: Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: Texas Beach is one of the nicest areas of the James River front.  Nice trail to get there with steps, bridges, various bike and people paths.  Not too overly crowded and a great mix of families and young people.

Great little trails to take your dog walking and to play in the river. There are trails close to the river and plenty of spots if you wanted to being floats/chairs to enjoy a day out on the river. There are signs that dogs need to stay on leashes, but we saw a few people who had their super well behaved dogs offleash. Everyone we passed was super friendly.

Amazing place to go. May want to be 420 friendly if you are heading here also okay with drinking. It seems to be the place young people go to swim the river and tube. But i would strongly suggest to check it out a great hidden spot in Richmond.
The place was beautiful! I ended up lost and took a while before finding my way back but I'll definitely go back next time I visit.

There arent as many people that come go this part of the James river as they Bell Isle is much more well know. This makes for a wonderful opportunity to enjoy the water without the crowds. Definitely will be coming back

name: Richmond Slave Trail
address: Brander St, Richmond, VA 23224, USA
reviews: The information was awesome but this trail is not being maintained & is super sketchy. We went a little way & when we started seeing discarded junk, we turned around. Wish it was a safe place because the information we did get was wonderful.
Love exploring this trail in our backyard with my daughter!

Incredibly important piece of history. Highly recommend this if you're in Richmond. The beginning and end were easy to follow, the middle was a bit difficult. The half on the river was a nice hike with insightful information.

Look we preserve the past for a reason. There is no pride in the slave history of this country but the slave trail offers a very nice walk that also offers you knowledge of our past that might be hard to swallow but if it opens minds and hearts its a perfect day.
I've been hitting the bike trail every Saturday for the last three Saturdays that... Fun fun fun. The trail is clean, no glass no trash and polite courtesy people.

name: Richmond National Battlefield Park's Civil War Visitor Center
address: 470 Tredegar St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: One of the best national Civil War battlefields in the East. The NPS has a visitors center in the historic Tredegar building that was used to make ammunition for the confederate state during the Civil War. There is a museum that accompanies the visitors center that tells the history of Richmond and the surrounding area before, during, and after the Civil War. The museum has treasured photos of the destruction of Richmond and maps that give a time period marking all events from 1861-1865. The museum is free to all and parking is available right next door.

We stopped by at the Richmond National Battlefield and there is a lot of history to learn. There are plenty of exhibits explaining different specific events and a few different 20 minute long videos that also do a great job explaining the history of this place.
Belle isle was so much more than i expected.   I will come back over and over.   So much to see and do.   Kayaking, rock climbing,  swimming or biking around the isle.   Great surprise.
Wonderful is all I can say. Amazing historical sites all around this area

Incredibly historical, being that Tredegar was of of the biggest manufacturers of weapons during the Civil War. The original artifacts, pictures and unique storytelling exhibits give you a good sense of what it was like to fight as a soldier on the front lines. For those who call Richmond "home," the pictures from the 19th century are near to see as compared to what the city looks like today.

When you're done with the museum, take a short walk to the river directly across the street for some hiking, swimming, paddleboarding and kayaking!

name: Virginia Museum of Fine Arts Sculpture Garden
address: Richmond, VA 23221, USA
reviews: Nice park with benches and tables under some large trees where you can sit down and relax. A very lovely place.
Stellar collection of Art Deco + Nouveau, lovely neighborhood accessibility.
The Sculpture Garden is peaceful and lovely. I enjoy visiting or at least walking through it several times a week on my daily walks.
Small but good.  Kudos for Rumors of War.

The sculpture garden at vmfa features contemporary artists like Jaume Plensa and other sculptures that really make the space interesting. There are water features and an installation of red Chihuly reeds. There is the Belvedere which is at the top of the garden she's a great place to sit along another fountain. The sculpture garden is conveniently located next to vmfa parking structure. There is also a Confederate Chapel on the opposite end of the property which is also open to the public for exploration and interpretation. There's another building on the grounds of the sculpture garden called the pauley center. If you enter the police enter you'll be able to see the vmfa fellowship recipients art hanging on the walls. Inside the museum there is a cafe and restrooms along with a world-class collection of art. Pop into the cafe for a cup of coffee and then come back outside to the sculpture garden to Center one of the umbrellas under the crepe myrtles. Admission to the museum is free and the sculpture garden is free and open all the time. Parties can be scheduled weddings are held and many family days are scheduled throughout the year to activate the sculpture garden.

name: Manchester Climbing Wall Parking
address: 599 W 11th St #553, Richmond, VA 23224, USA
reviews: This place will take you to the top. It's really raised my expectations. You can legally get high here. It's has scalable infrastructure.
a beautiful place to go for a walk, ride a bike and climb the truth an incredible place
Sweet climbing wall in downtown Richmond.  Nice brewery right behind the parking lot too.  Some bolts are a little sketchy, but overall seems in good shape.  Fun climbs for any skill level
Beautiful views from multiple areas. Great for photos!

Came here for the first time for the Folk Festival, figuring it would be easier to park and cross the bridge to Brown's isle. Well lit, smooth walkways, great views, overall very pleasant experience going through here. 3 hour limit on parking according to a posted sign, I couldn't tell you how well that's enforced but good to keep in mind.

name: Pump House Park
address: 1799 Pump House Dr, Richmond, VA 23221, USA
reviews: Very cool place. Was very happy to have been able to take a tour. I have been wanting to for years and it was even neater than I expected. The park itself is also nice. There are trails and beautiful views of the river. I absolutely love going here.
Spectacular place, very beautiful.

We often grab a to go breakfast and go walk around (follow the path towards the river) and sit to enjoy fresh air. It's a peaceful spot. Bonus: keep up with Friends of Pump house for chances to tour the inside! Just did it last week, very cool!
Wonderful place to visit and see where they used to have dances - Friends of the Pump House are working to restore it and do regular tours!
Great for hiking,  walking,  biking.  I plan to go back asap!

name: Deep Run Park & Recreation Center
address: 9900 Ridgefield Pkwy, Richmond, VA 23233, USA
reviews: Great facility for your large gathering! Huge ballroom area for events with 50+ people. Facility was clean, large windows to let the sun and air in. Paved back patio looking towards the woods in the park. Staff was very helpful and always with a smile. I would recommend this place for your reception and/or team building events as its tucked away within the park with ample parking spaces. They even had back doors to accommodate anything that needs to be rolled in!

I just visited  that park last weekend  and it's  amazing, full of nature, there is a big lake, many people goes there and take the dogs for a walk, or chill, I bet in the summer  and fall that looks stunning, beautiful  views!! there is like 2 or 3 recreation area for kids all ages, basketball court, parking lot, and you don't  pay to be there, it's  amazing  for those who like running and enjoying to be surrounded by nature! :)
Has a good mix of paved and I paved trails, easily accessible from a parking lot. Great for running and other recreation!

I love this park and all the different areas of it! From the trails to the lake to the fields. Last time I was here was for the annual American Foundation for Suicide Prevention (AFSP) Out of the Darkness Walk.
My grandchildren love to go to the"castle park " we we there  on last friday fo a couple hours.  Even in this  era of virus culture,  it was good to have them outside and having fun!

name: Robert E Lee Bridge
address: Richmond, VA 23224, USA
reviews: This bridge is neat! You can walk from the nearby island over to the Canal district, we did a long loop around the bulk of the greenway and this bridge was a standout. It hangs from the underside of the intersection and pausing in the middle, I was struck by the amazing things humans are capable of. Neat to be so near the river and also to see the interstate from below and marvel at our enginuity as a species.
It’s beautiful walking bridge. You can view Richmond Downtown nicely. If you like taking pictures this is the place.
Such a beautiful area. I highly recommend visiting.

With every step we got to take in the history, beauty and conquer some fears. It didn't cost me a thing to explore the river and walk around touring  the bridges and even stopping to have a picnic while watching the train drive by. All you have to do is park and get out. Let nature and exploration of history do the rest.

Beautiful view and a nice trail . Great place to go for a hike . Historical Native Land ! There's a walking bridge suspended under the over path that hangs and  wables  and is about a 20 minute walk to the other side.

name: The Grand Kugel
address: 2500 W Broad St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
