reviews: What more can you say about a gigantic stone sphere? It's a gorgeous ornament to the Science Museum entrance space, giving the seating area a peaceful atmosphere. A sculpture certainly worth paying a visit if you already have plans to tour the museum.
Absolutely beautiful at night! Can't wait to see it during the day.

breathtaking! I visited The Grand Kugel a bit skeptical. However 30 minutes later having pushed my heart and soul into spinning the giant stone earth with my Uber driver I am definitely convinced of its impressiveness.
Participated in seersuckers sundresses and sounds event.  It was a fun time.  Like huge party/cookout...huge.  plenty of live music dancing food shopping and libations.
For people who do not know this, the globe can be spun in different directions. It takes at least 3 people in order to attempt to do it  correctly.

name: Monroe Park
address: 620 W Main St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews:
I've been a Monroe Park visitor for well over a decade now. You'll hear a lot of people complain about what the city has done to the park most recently, but they're looking at the situation with rose-colored glasses. 

Despite a few flaws, Monroe Park has been revitalized by Richmond and VCU. On a nice day, it's filled with the bustling sounds of students and members of the community. It's now a hub where all types can come and feel safe.

It has a special meaning in my heart!!! When I was roughly 3 yrs the newspaper reporter took a photo of myself & 2 other children for the paper. We were kissing the statue that used to be there before the city changed it. But I like the openness of it along w/the gazebo.......still wish the statue had been fixed. It was there more than 50 yrs ago---it  WAS  a part of Richmond.
Beautiful old city park recently refurbished with support from citizens and Virginia Commonwealth University.
It's so clean and beautiful, nice area to just sit and take in the view of the amazing buildings.
Very clean and peaceful. A place to go read or to just enjoy the sound of the water from the ⛲

name: Historic St. John's Church
address: 2401 E Broad St, Richmond, VA 23223, USA
reviews: Definitely worth a visit even if you don't pay for the tour. Free to explore the grounds and check out the graves, including several of prominent people like Edgar Allan Poe's mother. Some gravestones date to 1700s and early 1800s. An incredible slice of early colonial American history.

This is a wonderfully beautiful, historical and peaceful place to visit.  If you didn't know, St. John's is where Patrick Henry gave his "Give me liberty or give me death" speech to the Second Virginia Convention.  The memorial to George Wythe, preeminent legal mind in 1700's and first professor of law at William & Mary - Tutor and mentor to Thomas Jefferson, Justice John Marshall, Henry Clay, James Madison among others is well marked. And if you look you'll find the grave site of Edgar Allan Poe's mother. The gift shop does have the Parish book behind the desk and provides some interesting insights over the centuries.

We made a pop in visit, just a short informal tour five or ten minutes inside the church and another ten minutes in the yard. It captures an important historical moment with some local context. The church is in the middle of a beautiful old neighborhood.
Nice very old place. Didn't take the tour

Experience the church where Patrick Henry gave his "Give me liberty or give me death" speech which got the Virginia militia formed and most likely saved the colonies. Betty gave an excellent job sharing the history of the building. About a 30 minutes tour.

name: Tuckahoe Plantation
address: 12601 River Rd, Richmond, VA 23238, USA
reviews: This venue is absolutely stunning! We were so impressed at how spacious it was for everyone to explore and roam. The history of the home was also such a cool touch for the guests traveling from the UK. They thought that was neat. The views to the river made for great photos. The staff at Tuckahoe were kind and so professional. they even helped me find some of my vendors! Thank You!!!!

Well designed and maintained garden. Historical house tour of main floor. A family lives here so upstairs and downstairs are private areas. They are gracious enough to share parts of their home and lovely property. I attended a tea and quilt event that used all parts of the space to display quilts and served tea and homemade goodies. Very nice event.

Perfect historical place to roam around alone or with family. Beautiful, happy-looking flock of sheep. Endless photo and video opportunities. Tucked away and private, but close to other destinations if you're going for a day trip.

There was a transcendent peace here wandering the grounds with the smell of flowers filling the warm breeze, butterflies everywhere and stunning garden spaces. I about peed myself when there was snorting in one of the beds but it was just the neighbors horse. Having been chased by an angry three-legged pig at one point in my life which started in much the same way (true story) this was the only interruption of the total serenity of this place. Meander don't run, but go. The long tree tunnel drive to the property is only the start of this magical experience. Park in the field, pay your $5 and enjoy 💕

A hidden gem only 20 minutes away from the city. The Tuckahoe Plantation is an incredible building from the 1700’s that still houses a family. What makes this place significant is this is where Thomas Jefferson spent several years growing up with his parents. There seems to be several architectural inspirations here at the Tuckahoe Plantation. Try to spot them if you can.  It’s a simple place, but I would encourage you to schedule a tour before heading down. You can schedule a tour by going on their website.

name: Huguenot Park
address: 10901 Robious Rd, Richmond, VA 23235, USA
reviews: A very nice park.  Has a large children's play gym and basketball court as you come in .  Soccer fields to the back .  Lots of parking.  Don't have knowledge of restroom facilities. Glad my grandson had his soccer game there so I had the opportunity to go and enjoy this gem in Chesterfield.
Beautiful place to walk trails or have a good read from the Girl Scout's donated book stand. Also a great place to sit by the river and have lunch on the picnic tables :)

As a homeschool family, we go to a lot of parks but this is definitely one of our favorite... not only because there is a donut shop close by 😉 The Park is fenced so I can sit in the front of the entrance and watch the kids. Also, they have swings for adults, which I love. It has nice hiking  area too but beware of the snakes 🐍

I really enjoy visiting here! It had an awesome, accessible playground, as well as restrooms,  tables, and pavilions. I think I even spotted some corn hole boards...
Only downside is that it can get very busy!

Great place to play with the kids. They have a large sand box with some toys, that are showing heavy usage but still usable. My son didn't seem to care which is all that matters.

 The largest playground playset I have yet to see and designed to be used by any age really. Some swings as well, though they are only for small kids.

name: Rockwood Nature Center
address: Richmond, VA 23236, USA
reviews:
Nicely done park with widely paved trails and staffed nature building. Several fields and courts to play various sports. Very large and well-maintained. 

Now if only the dog folks would be consistent in cleaning up their duties.  ;)
Never knew this place had a nature center! Great for hosting birthday parties. A very knowledgeable employee teaches the kids about the reptiles and you even get to pet them!
What a neat place to visit at Rockwood Park definitely something to the kids. Stumbled across this while walking the many hiking trails will definitely be back.
It's the starting point of a great walk. Just be ready to spend 45 minutes in the woods if you're going on a walk. If not it's just a cute place to stop in and look at stuff
An excellent park with numberous route on the trail to walk through. Plenty of shaded area with friendly staff.

name: Lucy's Restaurant
address: 404 N 2nd St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: This is a pretty neat spot downtown Richmond. It's quaint, clean, and has a good vibe. The food is delicious 👌, the portion sizes and generous and it is fairly affordable. They made a brilliant use of the space the available space. I will be returning. I have only had lunch here so far and i am planning on coming back for dinner. Highly recommended.

Good spot for lunch. I really like the aesthetics. Nice warm atmosphere with wood and bricks to bring a cozy feeling while you eat. Had the O'Brien with a soup side. The sandwich was delicious, striking a good balance between fillings and bread. The soup, can't remember the name, was the best part of the meal. A salty, sweet, creamy curry soup. Spicy with bits of nuts mixed in.

Finally made it here for dinner.   Managed a bar spot at 730pm with ease.  Thet had just changed the menu so it didn't match the website which was a disappointment.    Food was good, cocktails creative but service kind of distant and strained.  I will still go back and this is a must stop especially because it doesn't always pop up on simple web searches

I stopped by Lucy's on my way to Dillon on the Amtrak. This was truly the highlight of my brief stay in this city. This place is small and on the night I came, it was full but not crowded. Probably because it was the Saturday before christmas and folks were either broke or out shopping. I say at the bar and I was tended to by Katie who crafted excellent drinks and kept me filled on the most wonderful bread imaginable. I started off with the Cavender, Stranahans whiskey, Averna, Amaro & orange bitters. This was a great drink and Katie really put her heart into making it. She was a great multi tasker able to make a drink and take orders from servers walking to the bar. She also kept my water filled as well as my bread. For an appetizer i had the veggie cakes which were kind of bland and uneventful. Carrots and spinach. I am not really on the health kick movement so maybe I should have passed on this one. Next I ordered the fried oysters. These were a perfect ten. I could have ordered three more of these and made them a meal and considering how uninspiring my main dish was, I should have done just that. They came over bacon collard greens. You just know anything over bacon is going to be good. Now for my main dish I had the Colorado lamb shoulder. It sounded good on paper but I guess i got confused with lamb chops, like those tiny grilled lollipop type things with the bone sticking out, but this was like pulled pork. My problem was with the presentation. As soon as it hit the table I was like WTF is that pink stuff on top of my meat? F4om the picture you will see that it just was not appetizing. I take it that it was cranberry butter. This dish had a lot going on.Lamb shoulder, butternut squash, pecan apple bread pudding and that pinkish blob which i guess was the cranberry butte mixed into the bread pudding making it like a pink bread pudding. The apple pie was nothing special and I should have passed on that. But the menu is quite enticing. I would strongly consider either the cherry glazed duck breast or the pig and chicken salad next time. The bread was incredibly delicious and it was always delivered hot and fresh. Katie is what made this a five star experience for me. The lamb was not bad when I had it for leftovers the next morning. Overall I was extremely satisfied with the welcome i received, the attention at the bar, the expertly crafted drink, the ambiance, the timing of the presentation of the meals, the fresh bread, the creativity behind each dish and the price.  I will definitely be back again the next time I am in Richmond

Delicious brunch, amazingly friendly servers, very reasonable prices, all in a lovely, cozy space. We had brunch there while exploring the street festival, and loved everything. The ambiance is great. It's extremely nice and clean inside, with thoughtful touches large and small to be found. The servers were super friendly and helpful, and all around nice people. The star of the show is the food. Our brunch was absolutely delicious. We had grits with shredded pork and eggs, and it was amazing. Our side of roasted potatoes was creamy, a little sweet, and not oily or heavy at all. My favorite were the bacon donut holes. Crispy on the outside and heavenly soft on the inside. We will most certainly be coming back, and we almost decided to come back for a second brunch later in the same day!

name: Perly's
address: 111 E Grace St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews:
Committed the major issues of coming in with a large group during their rush and splitting all checks. They were more than accommodating, fun and gave us great service. Never pressured us to along.

Food was excellent. I had the corned beef hash, made fresh in house. Tried my buddies bagel and lox. Both the best I've had anywhere around. Ate it all before my camera had a chance!

Will be back and highly recommend!

This was recommended to us by a lot of locals so we changed our plans for brunch from somewhere else and went here instead. Definitely recommend coming here. The food was good, the wait staff was friendly and helpful. It was a little slow which is the only reason it’s not a 5, but overall would definitely come back. Pictured is the Benny Goodman

Have been here twice - enjoyed it so much the first time that we had to come back when passing through Richmond. Everything is really well done. Loved the fish board! The bagels, cream cheese, and lox options were all delicious and perfectly complemented by a variety of pickled things. Perly's has easily become a favorite that I will gladly continue to return to for an enjoyable meal and fun atmosphere.

Great food and generous proportions! Authentic like my mother in law made!  Only problem, we purchased bagels to take home and they were hard and stale!  We expected them to be the same quality as the food. We certainly will give it another try.

If you don't get the schlubby fries you're a heathen. Brunch isn't brunch without the salmon Benny. They have the only good bagels downtown. The wait on weekends is bananas. 45min to over an hour. But Stella's is next door and they're happy to have you wait there.

name: The Roosevelt
address: 623 N 25th St, Richmond, VA 23223, USA
reviews: I love their take on Southern dishes.  It is often difficult to get a table but I got lucky today!  The bar program is renowned.  Plenty of charm throughout the restaurant.

Delicious food and great service. Also, the cocktails were incredibly tasty. I liked that there was a nice space in between getting our appetizer and entrees. Some restaurants tend to rush and bring out entrees before you've even finished with the app; but The Roosevelt staff were all very attentive and the pacing of the meal was perfect. Perfect place for a nice night out when you want to enjoy your meal and company and not feel rushed.
Special Valentine's Day menu. Every single bite was amazing from the lamb tartar to the scallops to the chocolate cake. Best scallops I've had in years! Must go!

My first exposure to The Roosevelt was a quick phone call to make sure they had bar seating. My call was answered by a charming lady who not only assured me they do, but that I could get a full dinner menu. She even confirmed my arrival time to make sure I could be seated when I arrived. The drive from my hotel was somewhat I retesting because the neighborhoods I had to drive through were somewhat sketchy, but where the place is located is actually a very nice neighborhood going through a rebirth, with lots of young professionals, although the only parking available is on-street, but not metered.  When I went into the beautifully restored building I was met by the woman with whom I spoke, and she greeted me by name. I grabbed a seat at the bar after she introduced me to the bartender, Jesse. The bar was extremely well-stocked with top shelf and local liquors and wines, but only three craft beers and one cider. Their mixing ingredients are all fresh, locally-prepared and extensive. Herbs for muddling are in a planter on the bar along with an entire collection of various shrubs and fruits which Jesse regularly utilized in the creation of a number of high-end signature cocktails. And even as busy as he was, he still made time to chat with me about music, drinks, and whatever. The menu was diverse and matched the online version, so I  was able to order based on what I had seen online. The harder part was selecting a wine from the extensive menu. I ordered the seared scallops, which were excellent, although for the price, I would've hoped for a larger portion. Since I was still hungry, I went back for dessert, an excellent little dish of absolutely decadent chocolate mousse. Overall, an excellent meal in great surroundings hosted by great people.

We were spending the night in Richmond and happened upon The Roosevelt. What a fortunate find. The atmosphere is very cool, old hardwood floors, tin ceilings, very high. The service was top notch and the food was even better. My wife had the chicken fried portobello mushroom and I had the pan roasted scallops...we shared the roasted beet salad for an appetizer and the peanut butter pie for dessert. We started the night with drinks and liked mine well enough to ask for a recipe which the bartender came over and shared. Turned out to way too involved to make at home but man it was good. We will eat here again in an instant, next time we are in Richmond!

name: Lemaire
address: 101 W Franklin St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: Celebrated an anniversary dinner at Lemaire recently. Have always loved the Jefferson for its rich history, architecture and historic Richmond feel. The restaurant is located near the hotel check-in area and has a very active/popular bar right outside of the dining area. This can be highly trafficked on a Friday evening during happy hour, but we were able to find a place to sit and have a drink before our reservation. Wait staff was helpful and kind. As with most public areas of the Jefferson, the bar and restaurant have wonderful high ceilings and mouldings that create great ambiance and character of the hotel.
Beautiful, calm atmosphere. Wonderful food & wait staff. Extra touches offered free of charge.

The food was delicious. The setting is rich in history. You can feel comfortable dressing up (though some people still wear jeans 🙄). While the wait staff was attentive, I was surprised that our waiter never offered the drink menu back after we finished our first drinks, even with the empty glasses moved to the edge of the table. If asked, I likely would have gotten a glass of wine to go along with my meal after I finished my cocktail, but didn't feel strongly enough to call the waiter out on it. Anyway, this is more of a 4.5 because we have had great experiences in the past too.

High-end experience during the holidays
What's not to enjoy?  Always have a great time celebrating at Lemaire. Food and service is exceptional.  The butternut squash soup was spectacular.
Excellent service and food was very good. The salmon was phenomenal. The honey pot dessert was delicious.

name: L'Opossum
address: 626 China St #626, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: I took my boyfriend here for our second anniversary and we had a memorable experience! We looked at previous reviews for this place before we arrived and were not disappointed. The escargot was absolutely amazing. Not at all chewy and rubbery like one would think snails would be like. I’m not even a fan of escargot, but these were seriously the best I’ve ever had and would recommend to anyone who enjoys escargot. Don’t be afraid to ask what a dish is. The wait staff are prepared and ready to answer in detail to any questions you may have.  The ambience and decor.. is certainly interesting. Very quirky and fun place. If you are planning on dining here, I would advise to make a reservation a few weeks ahead as this place is very quickly booked.

The atmosphere is cozy, with a contrast of dark woods and beautiful light. The decorations are new but have a nostalgic feel to them. The long bars are inviting and the staff is really nice. And there's something about a nice atmosphere that relaxes everyone and makes them friendly, which is part of what I love about this place. I always make new friends here without even trying.
Everything about this place is aMAZing! The people, the decor, and definitely the food. It truly was art. The crab cakes were by far the best I've ever had. Absolutely an adventure beginning to end.
Unique atmosphere and one of a kind food for the most part. Some variations on some old classics that are used all over. But delicious non the less.

This place was highly recommended to me and I found it to be underwhelming. I was excited upon entering, the staff were excellent and the decor was amazing. The water was mint infused and delicious and I couldn't wait to sink my teeth into some yummy food. We ordered their special appetizer, a creamy crab concoction on top of pureed spinach (sort of looked like flan). Which was yummy, my partner enjoyed it but the mushiness threw me off. I was still excited as this was a personal preference turn off.  Alas, while the food was good I did not feel it was good enough to justify the price and it did not blow us away. I got the Swank Bank, which was advertised as mac n cheese, but it was served with shell pasta (not macaroni) and had a liquid creamy cheese sauce rather than the gooey cheese that I had anticipated. It was very buttery and while it was good, I was not blown away. My favorite part about the dish was the asparagus and the leafy greens at the bottom. My partner ordered the Beef "Swellington" which he said was over salted, but still good. He shared the same sentiment that I did, good food, but not amazing food. The best part about his dish was by far the mushroom, which he generously shared half of the only mushroom on his plate with me. The mushroom was amazing and very yummy. We opted out of dessert and alcoholic drinks. All in all I don't regret my visit, but I am not salivating to return.

name: Rappahannock Restaurant
address: 320 E Grace St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: This is probably my favorite Richmond restaurant. It’s a go to for any special occasion. I’ve never had a meal I wasn’t satisfied with and it’s really great to get fresh seafood, perfectly prepared. I would LOVE to see more local, Virginia caught fish on the menu.
Everything was delicious! Atmosphere is laid back and chic. Customer p is on point. Definitely will be a repeat customer.
Great raw oysters, a nice selection. Nice decor, and our waiter was outstanding. Nice selection of wine by the glass. Interesting menu- and everyone agreed that the food was good, but... Not great.

3-1/2? Overpriced, but accessible. As a seafood enthusiast, I respect the preparation and attention necessary for quality. The cost is simply not comparable to the meals that either myself or my friends have experienced on multiple attempts. Optimism in the variety brings us back, but we are always underwhelmed by bland flavoring or small portions. The staff is excellent, informed and courteous.

We had a fabulous dining experience at Rappahannock's! Quaint atmosphere and food served tremendously fresh and quick due to an event we were attending, in which we asked the server and they provided with a "Wow"! Recommend the cheese tray small plate and anything/everything from the entree menu.

name: Shagbark
address: 4901 Libbie Mill E Blvd, Richmond, VA 23230, USA
reviews:
The decor is modern rustic.  I love the large vertical slices of wood separating the rooms.  Plenty of outside, covered tables.

Food presentation is a number one priority.  It's a very imitative place.  The service was a little spotty.

The meat and cheese appetizer was amazing, probably better than the main course.  The pimento cheese could be the best I ever had.  It's a must have.

On of the best restaurants in Richmond. Our experience was outstanding. I had the rabbit but there were many awesome selections for people not as brave as I.  The wine list was good as well. 

On the way in I noticed several great selections of whiskey. It was quite and cozy with an excellent wait staff. 👍👍

Magnificent restaurant with local ingredients, wonderfully prepared dishes and outstanding customer service.  The restaurant boasts a gorgeous dining room in the newly constructed Libbie Mill development.  It has very few competitors in Richnond who can deliver at this level!

Wonderful salmon, excellent service.

This is a little higher end than I usually eat, but this place doesn't throw it in your face the same way some places do. Their focus is on providing quality food with quality service and by both measures they succeed.

Good for couples or groups of varying size, with a good range of selections to fit most diets. They also know their way around a duck, a particularly valuable trait these days.

The food was great, and the rest of the dining experience was about what I would expect of a three dollar sign restaurant.   

I'm only giving 3 stars because I hope management takes note of below to improve future interaction with others.

I am however sadly disappointed in the care of customers needs.  We had made a reservation early in the dining timeframe, and I had clearly requested in my reservation a seating request to help the evening go more smoothly.  However, when we arrived, and we were the first guests to be seated in the dining area, the complete opposite of my request was granted.  One seat backed to the middle of the dining room, and the other backed to the bar and beside the waiter station/service bar.  The place was empty so I didn't make a fuss about it as I figured it would make little difference when not busy,  I wish I had.  About half way through our dining the place near instantly filled and all the difficulties that I had hoped to avoid were as bad as they could be. 

I hope that in the future, when your establishment receives a request that someone took the time to write and explain why, that at least a shred of effort is put in to accommodating that request.

name: Heritage Restaurant
address: 1627 W Main St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews:
Food was phenomenal. It’s very close to 5 star food no question. Cocktails were 5 star as well.  Phenomenal duck breast. Perfect tuna tartare. Great desserts. 

Why I’m only going 4 stars though. Reservation was for 6:15, actual seating was 6:45. The dessert course got lost and ended up about 30 minutes between main and dessert. And lastly tuna steak was cooked medium well. It was still super tasty, but that’s too much for tuna.

The booth by the door, next to the front windows are a tight fit. They have maximized their space with tables and seating for guest. So if it's a full house it will feel like a full house. This placed seems to be very popular. You are treated like a VIP once you step inside. Our server was excellent. She knew the entire menu & drinks menu. The drink she suggested was delicious. In fact I had 2 of them🍹 
Loved the specialty names for their signature drinks. The food was great. The portions filled me up. Very very nice place for an evening with friends or family. Staff seem to work well together. It was all smiles from everyone. Totally enjoyed my visit and would recommend stopping in.
Delicious food excellent service. I had the smoked sausage with potatoes and it was so crispy. Def going back

My husband and I booked Heritage for our rehearsal dinner the night before our wedding, and it was some of the best food, service, and ambiance we've ever had. We had about 60 people in the restaurant, which was the perfect number...full but not crowded. Emilia and all of the staff were so wonderful to work with for every part of the process, they made it easy and stress-free! Every single guest loved the fabulous food and specialty cocktails, we got so many compliments about this restaurant. Many guests said they would want to come back to Richmond just to eat here. My husband and I will be lifelong fans of Heritage, it honestly could not have been a better experience! Thank you for your wonderful work!

The place was full but the four of us could still carry on a conversation.  Our waiter, Cate, was great.  Best of all was the food!  Wife had the soft shell crab and enjoyed it.  My monk fish was even better than the rock fish we had shared our first time here.  Fried broccoli is a must have.  This is our most favorite restaurant in Richmond - more enjoyable than the famous hotel.

name: Saison
address: 23 W Marshall St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: Wonderful service (at the bar), staff are very polite and welcoming. Drinks were tasty, but not a good selection for vodka drinkers. There appeared to be several varieties of every other type of spirit though. Nice wine selection. Tasty small plates. Great atmosphere. Overall pleasant experience.

Amazing food, great service, loud as hell. Really flavorful dishes, not overtly Latino in the usual way but perfectly inspired. Cauliflower and skate wing small plates and pork and hanger steak large plates were all hits. Otherwise an excellent date spot but it was deafeningly loud and the tables are a bit crowded.  I would definitely still return.

This is one of my favorite Richmond gems. It is tiny so you will need reservations. We had a large group of people and ended up ordering just about everything on the small plates menu and it was all amazing. This place is known for amazing cocktails. If you're not sure what to order tell your server what you like and the bartender will be able to come up with something fabulous. Our server was amazing and super sweet all night.

Great experience! Food is innovative and Rich. At first glimpse of the menu, you may be thinking that there is not a lot here. Oh, but it is! The food is super creative and flavorful. This was our first visit here and we will be back for sure!

Have been here before for food and it is definitely 5 stars! But also a great cozy place to swing in for a cocktail or two. It's in a GREAT location for easy walking to some fun entertainment! Love the super kind and efficient service I have gotten every. single. time.

name: Brenner Pass
address: 3200 Rockbridge St #100, Richmond, VA 23230, USA
reviews: Beautiful Restaurant, amazing food and generous drinks. I visited Brenner Pass for New Years with my husband and friends. Located in Scott’s Edition and away from the busy area. Parking was available close by. Everything we ordered was delicious. I can’t recommend this place enough. Be prepared for a pricier meal but it is well worth it. Service was great. Come here for a special occasion. Lobster Risotto and Scallops just melt in your mouth. Best dessert was the tiramisu.

Service that was both fantastic and above 'n beyond any expectations. Phenomenal food and cocktails, with a few special liquor selections too. A great place for celebrations of all kinds - especially anniversaries.

I like this place more for the ambiance than for the food. But if you really want a fun experience, ask for the cheese cart. If you are ordering a cheese plate they will bring around this cheese cart (like a dessert cart) and explain all the cheeses to you. Then you can sample the ones that peak your interest before you place your cheese plate order. Genius.

Another great restaurant in Richmond Virginia. The garlic soup as an appetizer is simply amazing. The service was stellar. As expected the roysters were way overpriced. The Friday wasters were delicious. And the artichoke was incredible. It's a little cold inside. It she can modern but lacks a little character. Over all the experience was grand. I will be back to taste more...

This evening we have enjoyed a fabulous meal at Brenner Pass. In the past we have liked some offerings at this eatery but tonight absolutely everything was perfectly prepared. I began with the Ocean Spray Cocktail which was tart and refreshing followed by the Arugula and Apricot Salad with Pistachio Vinaigrette which was delicious and large enough to share. For entree I chose the Saffron Risotto with Crab which was extremely fresh and flavorful. My husband enjoyed the Halibut with Charred Vegetables with an unusual and altogether tasty sauce. We concluded our meal by sharing a fantastic dessert of fruit, toasted hazelnuts and pistachio ice cream on spicy pound cake...I've forgotten the name of the dish but not the great taste. The flavor combinations at Brenner Pass are unusual and sometimes surprising but you won't find a better meal anywhere and service that is prompt efficient and pleasant. A truly great experience!

name: Nota Bene | Restaurant & Bar
address: 2110 E Main St, Richmond, VA 23223, USA
reviews:
For my wife’s birthday we always do Italian food. We decided to go away for her birthday so we ended up in Richmond. Found this place and it had good reviews so we checked it out.

Pro: The ambiance was great and the restaurant is really nice. The service was good/helpful as well. The food was fine, nothing to write home about but not bad. The pizza was good though, that I recommend

Con: We originally order Focaccia as an appetizer. When they brought it out we were told this was the last one they had. What they gave us resembled, both in look and taste, was regular table bread. We told the waitress who told us this was their focaccia. They took it back and it wasn’t on the bill(thank you by the way). The other food we got was fine.

Nota Bene is one of my favorite Italian restaurants in Richmond.  Actually, one of my favorite restaurants period.  The food is delicious, and the service is warm and welcoming.  It's a great place to have a fancy date, or just a casual meal at the bar.  Always happily full and pleased with my experience every time I eat here.

This is my FAVE place in Richmond. My boyfriend and I are regulars there now, and the staff always welcome us. Our favorite thing to do is go for Tuesday Date Night ($60 for 3-course meals, for 2! And a bottle of wine). We both highly recommend Nota Bene––authentic, delicious, and memorable.

I ordered white bolognese and it was amazing eventho portion wasn’t filling and I felt I needed a lot more to feel stuffed. My wife ordered this branzino and it was super aesthetically pleasing and can’t comment on fish taste since I don’t like seafood specially fish.
The food was excellent. I'll go back again for the mushroom pasta. Heirloom tomato appetizer was outstanding.

name: Edo's Squid
address: 411 N Harrison St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews:
I had the rock fish!!! It was delicious!! Very bold in flavor and filling as it was served with pasta. 
The fried squid was great as well. The seafood mixed pasta was great as well. It was spicy.

Amazing food, huge portions, attentive waiters. The mussels were delicious, the mixed seafood spaghetti and the meat sauce were fantastic. However, it is quite noisy, and the fish are quite expensive.

Sausage, Broccoli Rabe - a meal to rave about! A perfect amount of heat spices this pasta and Italian sausage dish.  I crave it. Huge portion allows for ample leftovers fit for another meal. Lunch time is my favorite time to go; relaxing with great people watching from the second floor windows overlooking Harrison. Perfection.

Hidden gem! It’s a must go to in Richmond. I can’t get enough of the broccoli rabe and fried squid. I take everyone that’s visits here! They definitely know how to cook and make the best combinations of flavor I’m each meal. The staff so friendly and welcoming. It can be noisy when busy but the food is so good it doesn’t matter!

Way underpriced for what you get!  My daughter and I were looking to catch a quick bite before the symphony at the Alistra and this place came up in reviews.  It's only about a  9 minute walk from the theater. 

Admittedly, we weren't sure we were in the right place when open the door and see a sketchy looking walk-up you assume you're going to the employee entrance of the restaurant that's downstairs. We were going to pass based on the entrance until we saw happy faces coming out. 

I'm glad we went up that sketchy walk-up.  It's a single room restaurant, with moderate bar and you can see into the alley kitchen from the dining area, but those quirky things make it charming. 

The servers were fantastic and the menu is simple.  The food was incredibly good and I especially liked the steamed muscles.  The portions are very large for lunch and the price was much lower than I had anticipated.  

It is a small area and were literally sitting side-by-side with other diners, so if you're looking for a quiet restaurant to have a private conversation, this isn't it.  However, everyone we sat near was pleasant and happy.

name: Mama J's Kitchen
address: 415 N 1st St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews:
It's fairly small so be prepared to wait for a table right around the busiest windows. 

Menu revolves around chicken, catfish, pork chops, crab cakes and ribs. With sandwich or entree takes on those main proteins. 

Side dishes are generously sized and really big enough for two people. Salads are very large. 

Very friendly staff and reasonable prices round out the experience.

This place is fantastic. Everything I've ever ordered here has been just delicious. I highly HIGHLY recommend the catfish. They have the best collard greens I've ever had in my life and their sweet tea is amazing too. Don't forget to finish your meal with a very generous slice of cake- it doesn't matter which one you get because they are all fantastic. Their staff are all super friendly and service is prompt as well. All around 10/10, you can't go wrong choosing to eat here.

This restaurant is amazing! We went on a Monday night and had only a 15 minute wait to be seated. My party of four all enjoyed their entrees. I had the fried catfish with a side of cabbage. Perfect crisp on the fish, succulent cabbage, both nicely spiced but not too much. The rest of our group had the fried chicken. They raved about the crispiness, moist meat and flavor. We got coconut cake and peach cobbler to go--yum! We will definitely be repeat customers, we all loved Mama J's Kitchen!

Fries catfish was delicious. The catfish nuggets were similar to the fried catfish. Candied yams were a little too sweet as expected. Peach pie was delicious. Fried chicken plate was also great. The Mac and cheese was a little disappointing. Staff was super friendly. Easy to find parking

Honestly wasn’t impressed with what we ordered.  (Ribs and chicken) The sides were decent but nothing to tell your neighbor about.  However the couple sitting next to us seemed to enjoy their picks.  We may just need to revisit and try something else on the menu. The cake looked amazing, may also be worth another try.

name: Bookbinder's Seafood & Steakhouse
address: 2306 E Cary St, Richmond, VA 23223, USA
reviews: Our first visit to Bookbinders was in January. It's located in a nice convenient area, and has a little history to it. The service is quite good, but not spectacular. The ambiance was a bit dull during our visit. They have a great wine list. Standard cocktails. All of the dishes are cooked perfectly, especially the steaks. They must use high quality meats because the fillet and strip are to-die-for amazing; get an accompanying sauce. The lobster is wonderful and tastes so fresh. The scallops are also good. All of the appetizers are good, you can't go wrong with any of them. The sides are okay, not so special. Do not order the lobster mac and cheese here, as there was no visible lobster at all in ours. They say they pre-measure out 2 ounces of lobster for each lobster mac, but ours was definitely sans-lobster. They couldn't remake ours because the kitchen was closing so the waitress was to take it off our bill, but forgot. All of the deserts are good, as well as the desert wines. I would recommend Bookbinders for: specials group outtings, an anniversary, business dinners, a date night where you want to be treated.

Family holiday dinner was superb! Party of 6 we received excellent and friendly service. The food was delicious and of course we shared a few cups of cheer. Really one of the best RVA restaurants. Merry Christmas!

Food and service were amazing. The menu looked so good, we were undecided on what to get. Definitely a top class place with great service and an amazing chef. We will be back to try some more menu items.

I took my wife to Bookbinders for a romantic evening.  We ended up paying a little over 200 dollars for our meal, and to be honest it was more than worth the price.  Actually, I would have gladly paid 300 for our meal. 

I have dined all over the world and Bookbinders is now in my my top three for overall dining experiences ever.  Definitely top two for dining in Virginia.  

I would like to thank the manager and staff for a truly top shelf experience.

5 stars for every aspect of our incredible dinner.

Food was excellent.  Everything tasted like it was well made and with care.  Waiter was very helpful in recommendations for both food and drinks (Wine).  Service was fairly fast and prices were decent for the quality of restaurant.

name: Dutch & Company
address: 400 N 27th St, Richmond, VA 23223, USA
reviews:
Wanted something special for Valentine's Day.  Luckily, I planned several weeks in advance because it was almost sold out.

Wonderful prefix 5 course meal.  The app were mind blowing.  The craftmanship and presentation was truly amazing.  The handkerchief pasta was a little salty but it worked perfectly.  The oysters and chorizo with some mashed potatoes was super tasty.

The steak was a little spicy and nicely cooked.  The desserts were very unique.  Overall, the service and food presentation made a wonderful special occasion.
Went for our anniversary, my wife and I did the prix fixe (3 courses for $30 apiece) and we greatly enjoyed the food and ambiance.  Our waiter was very good.  The house red was on point.
Dined here for my birthday and had a wonderful experience. Service and food were excellent. Great  cocktails and wine selection. The perfect egg.... is unforgettable. Will be a new fav spot for us.

Had dinner last night for Richmond Restaurant Week, and it was fabulous! Staff was super friendly, environment was cosy, easy parking, and the food was exquisite. They are not lying when they say it is "the perfect egg!" can't wait to come back again soon and try the regular menu as well.

Went to Dutch and Company with my wife and was very delighted by the bar selection and unique food offerings. We’ve been back four times and love every single dinner and cocktail. I even got to meet the owner last time and Michelle is lovely. Will definitely be back.

name: Kuba Kuba
address: 1601 Park Ave, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: Great hidden gem in the fan district. The portion sizes are huge. You can definitely share with someone. The atmosphere is energetic. The food is pretty decent. The tres leches cake and Cuban coffee is awesome. The only reason I give it four stars is the service is pretty slow. Also there isn’t much seating so prepare to wait. But other than that, definitely recommend.
absolutely LOVE them! Service, prices and food😁 I just wish I had more pics to share! All I know is you will not be disappointed here!

Awesome Cuban restaurant in Richmond. Was in town for about an hour and stumbled across this place to be greeted by lovely staff and delicious food. It was my first time trying Cuban and it sure won’t be my last (if it’s usually as good as this place’s food). Would definitely recommend, but a word of caution - it’s very filling! :)

The food and coffee are always amazing!  We tried dessert for the first time and it won't be the last time.  The Guava Cheesecake was phenomenal.   The bread pudding was good but cold.  Not used to bread pudding being cold but that may be the way the serve it.
Wonderful food, great service, Coke products. Things are a little expensive, but the portion size is worth the price!!

name: Acacia mid-town
address: 2601 W Cary St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: The prix fixe menu is an excellent bang for the buck! The food is good and it’s obvious there is lots of care put into the dishes. The service was good and attentive, but the delivery of the food was a bit slow. All things considering, the price for these three courses and some wine on a Saturday night was excellent. Just make sure you have enough time to enjoy!

I've had many fantastic meals with the quality of food, drinks, and service all being top notch. So disappointing that this iteration is closing as it's the one place I could always count on for a quality meal for the last 10 years. The best things here were the crab cakes, most fish, scallops, duck, and especially the ceviche. Hopefully it will all be back and as good as ever sometime soon!

I’m sad to hear this place is closing. My one and only meal here was last night and it was one for the books. Beet Salad, scallops with gnocchi, crab cakes with grits...The chef truly knocked it out of the park with our meal and the service was as good as it gets. This restaurant will be missed!
Seriously good food. Makes reservation, enjoy yourself. They have valet parking if you don't like hunting for a spot.
Tasty food, really good work trying to get into fine dinning. The food has a great flavor and comes to the table really hot. The service needs to organize better but overall they did a great job.

name: Amuse
address: 200 N Arthur Ashe Blvd, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews:
We came here for brunch on Sunday. I only wish it opened at 11 instead of 11:30. Good thing we got here a couple minutes before it opened because we did not have reservations. The restaurant went from being empty to almost full very quickly! 

Our server was informative and did a great job. Their brunch menu had some good choices. A welcome surprise was complimentary chunks of soft bread with fruit in it, one for each of us that came out before our meal. 

For brunch, we went with the quiche and the stuffed apple French toast. Portions were much bigger than expected! Very generous. The quiche was divine— so soft and it practically melted in your mouth. It came with some salad greens. 

Stuffed French toast was like a sandwich, and it also came with bacon and tiny square-shaped cut apples around it. Dessert was the chocolate tarte which was a square shaped chocolate mouse with raspberry sauce around it and a scoop of cream with a raspberry on top. It’s one of my favorite brunch places thus far.

Thanks to a bartender who took the time to listen to the things I enjoyed, I decided to have lunch at the wonderful Amuse Restaurant, located on the top level of the museum overlooking their beautiful grounds. The space is flooded with natural light that immediately lifts your spirits, and prepares you for your amazing meal and cocktails. Perfect for a small group or large. Just remember to make a reservation!

Consistently rated as one of the top fine dining restaurants in Richmond, Amuse serves creative dishes in a delightful setting, within the Virginia Musem of Fine Art. There are two dining rooms indoors, an adjacent  bar area, and a large outdoor balcony for dining as well. It is only open limited evenings during the week, and it is best to make reservations.

This restaurant goes hand-in-hand with the art museum it sits on top of!  Beautiful, natural lit location with fantastic decor.  The menu was a bit limiting, and the options weren't as tasty as we thought they would be, but it was still good food with great atmosphere and staff!
Love Amuse. We've visited this restaurant several times. I dont think we have had any complaints. The staff is wonderful, the drinks are creative, and the food is great.

name: Croaker's Spot | Richmond
address: 1020 Hull St, Richmond, VA 23224, USA
reviews: We went on a weeknight and it was busy, but we were seated immediately. I ordered the restaurant week special, which was delicious and a really good deal. Everyone else was happy with their meals, we took lots of leftovers home, but the thing that impressed me most was the service. Mia was so hospitable and took very good care of us the whole time, even when she had another large party to attend to. Thank you for a great dinner!

We went to celebrate Valentines Day! A bit of a wait but not too bad and we expected it. Great atmosphere BUT the bar room dining waitress ONLY serviced the white patrons!!! YES! Totally overlooked us and then I watched her the entire time. Even when I very kindly asked if she was our waitress, she said yes, but then sent one of the bartenders to service us. That bartender/waitress was nice however, just prior to her waiting on us I went to the bar to order us drinks(thinking that would prompt our waitress to come to us after waiting on the white couple that was seated after us). Got our drinks but was told she didn’t swipe my card and handed it back to me saying they’d just add it to our food bill. Well guess what? She did swipe it and charged my card for  the drinks and then they also put the drinks on our bill!!!!  That was so disappointing! The food was delicious though.

Our waitress was wonderful- professional yet personable. We got fried shrimp and Mac. THE BEST I’ve had since relocating here from Boston area. The music choice was perfect and the atmosphere- the atmosphere!
Can’t wait to go back- O wait/ we got 4 different slices  of cake to go just because. Fabulous 
Thank you Croaker!!!

This place is amazing, the staff works really hard. The food is excellent. I came all the way from Newport News this past weekend and it was well worth it...Talking with the locals while waiting was awesome as well. Keep up the good work. Scale of 1 to 10, I give it a 12

Serving size was fantastic. I was able to eat on my fish dinner for 2 days. I gave 4 stars because my broccoli was barely steamed. It may have been an off day... the mac n cheese looked fantastic but wasn't flavorful.

name: Christopher's Runaway Gourmay
address: 2-98 S 12th St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews:
Oh my goodness, best chicken salad ever.
I was looking for a hot dog and found them.
I will attempt to pass them when ever I'm downtown.  The price is very reasonable. I had cucumbers and fruit  with it .
I WILL BE BACK !!
Cash only. Absolutely love the chicken salad. The sesame noodles are also quite good.

got chicken salad here on a recommendation (i'm generally not a big chicken salad fan) a few years ago and it is awesome. been getting the chicken salad with a side of fruit and cheese ever since. one of the best bangs for the buck around (note that it is cash only)

Cash Only.

Excellent flavors - sesame noodles, marinated cucumbers, tarragon chicken salad, pesto pasta, block of cheese or chunk of bread.

Generous servings of quality ingredients.

Memorable staff making jokes with their regulars and newcomers.

Very reasonable pricing.

Not only is this the best value in Richmond.  Christophers undeniably has the greatest chicken salad ever!  If you’re downtown around lunchtime you must pass by all the other food carts and treat yourself to this amazing lunch!

name: La Grotta Ristorante
address: 529 E Broad St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: Lovely restaurant with multiple cozy spaces for dining. The staff was friendly and very knowledgeable about the menu and wine pairings. We had the wine dinner and we were not disappointed. The servings were large and every bite was delicious. We were dressed for a casual concert at The National and it wasn't an issue. We'll be back for sure! Thanks!

La Grotta was recommended to us by a friend and boy are we glad that did. This is the quintessential Italian date night restaurant.  Great wine, pasta, and bread.  We had the ravioli with ricotta and spinach and a fettuccine with creamy tomato sauce. Both were so creamy and delicious, despite being full we ended up eating all of the food! It was a great meal and we will be back if we are ever back in Richmond.

Upscale Italian restaurant in downtown Richmond, located at the neighbor of Hilton. You can use the parking lot on either side of the restaurant (remember to pay).

The restaurant is suitable for dinning from two to the group of around 40. You can choose 3, 4 or 5 dishes or just select your entree. I’ve tried seafood, beef and chicken, all are cooked with great texture and flavor. Different wine choices. The dessert is the best I’ve ever had in Richmond. Chef is from Italy.

Waiters and waitresses are professional. They tried to understand your need and give helpful suggestions.

Reservation is recommended, especially if you have a big group or you are to take dinner. They have a view of the Broad Street.

Awesome service, great food and great wine selection! Our server Carolina was fantastic! We asked her to pick out our meal for our 5 course dinner and she did an amazing job. She also recommended our wine which was great! Very knowledgeable staff and great food. A must try for any Italian lovers.

First time here and we chose the 3 course wine menu.  It was great.  They paired a different wine with each course.  It was nice to try wines we otherwise might not select.  Food was fabulous and plentiful.

name: Garnett's
address: 2001 Park Ave, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews:
Another fantastic fan restaurant. Quaint but full of personality, the inside reminds me of an old soda bar. 

They're missing a Reuben, but nobody can be perfect. Sandwiches, both hot and cold are all unequivocally great. If you're into salads, they've got some interesting ones there too. Grab a soup and a slice of cake before you head out. As of today, they have a great deal for a date night.
As good as the reviews say it is, got "The Manny", next time will try "The Teacher". Great fresh food and great service.

What a nice little, neighborhood sandwich shop.  You walk into the small restaurant and you feel like you're in your Grandma's house.  The food is fantastic, there are always seasonal soups that are off beat but delightful.  The sandwiches don't reinvent the wheel but they show you what a classic is supposed to be and do it better than anyone else.  To top it off, there's always a few options for desert (usually pies and cakes) which are top tier in the city.  Some of the deserts are even gluten free (for any of you with Celiac's) and you can't tell.  Go check this place out.
Great cozy place, the sandwich was delicious (The Point Guard). And to top off the great experience, they had Modest Mouse's "The Moon and Antarctica" album playing. Can't beat that!

Great little deli in the neighborhood. Fantastic sandwiches and salads. Potato salad is amazing. Large portions of meat on the sandwiches and they have nice happy hour specials. 
If it’s a nice day it’s great to eat at the small park across the street!

name: Julep's New Southern Cuisine
address: 420 E Grace St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: We came for a special night out and loved it! The food was delicious and creative with enough of a comforting southern touch to let you know you’re still in Richmond. We had excellent service and can’t wait to visit again.

I made a reservation online @12:42pm for a party of 6 for me and my family (4) kids. I received an email @4:32pm stating that the reservation was declined. I walk in not having any idea that a reservation can be declined. Fine that is my fault for not checking my email. However......the hostess makes a recommendation for me and my (4) kids to sit at the bar......like really? Been here 3 other times and absolutely love the flavor of the food. After this last episode though not sure if I’ll be returning.....the bar ma’am really???? With my (4) kids.....c’mon

Nice place to go to relax.  Bartender was awesome and served drinks that were well made.  Only 1 TV is available here so not the best place to go to for watching sports while having a drink.  Happy hour prices were fairly good!

I came here for Restaurant Week and made reservations. They asked if we could sit outside since they didn't have space inside and the weather was nice so we sat outside. It was fine but what bothered me was that bare tables outside were kinda dirty. They didn't wipe them down or anything. They would put new utensils on the table before each course but they put the utensils on the dirty table without a napkin or anything underneath. Also some  of the courses came out not hot. For example, I had the biscuits and gravy appetizer and the apple pie dessert and both came out very lukewarm/cold. I did not enjoy either. I did however get the shrimp and grits for my main course and that was delicious. I also thought the waiter was nice and always kept our water glasses full, but the girl who greeted us and sat us to the table was kind of rude.

I had been meaning to go here for years, but last night was my first time. I was blown away by the service, the food, the chef, and the ambiance. I want to start with the hostess. Her outfit and demeanor was stunning with her pink dress and pearl necklace. So nice and polite and attentive. Then our waiter... so this guy... the class of this guy. Outstanding service all around from him. He even accommodated us when she said she couldn't eat the cornbread that came out first by giving us other options. The food came out later, and it was delicious. Fantastic shrimp and grits. Some of the best I've ever had, and definitely the spiciest. I was unaware I needed this in my life. I would happily come back here. Nothing but praise to the staff in all regards. Everyone should go. Now. Stop what you're doing and go. Even if they aren't open, just set up shop outside and wait til they do.

name: Citizen
address: 1203 E Main St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: The food is consistently good! Their soups are excellent. They are usually hearty, delicious and gluten-free. The homemade jams are unique and tasty. This is my favorite breakfast spot in downtown Richmond.

I had the Disco Eggs w/ Avocado with squash salad as my side and a Thai iced coffee. Everything was so flavorful and cooked to perfection. The local eggs especially were amazing with delicious orange runny yokes. No pretentiousness here to my eyes but dishes that are executed to a level that many other higher priced establishments don't match.

Awesome breakfast/brunch spot.  Good spot for Bloody Mary’s and laying down a solid base before hitting the breweries.  Very eclectic mix of breakfast options with amazing flavors, spices and taste.  Loved the Disco Eggs!  Go!  You won’t be disappointed!

Great place for breakfast. I had the pupusas and beet soup. Both were extremely delicious. The staff is very friendly and the vibe here is very cool. I'll definitely come back here again. The staff told me this gem of a place is shutting down in March, so eat up, people!
The food was amazing and nicely portioned.  Staff was quick and professional in terms of service.  Seating is difficult and your party must be complete before they will seat you.

name: The Hard Shell
address: 1411 E Cary St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: Tasty food. We went for lunch.  The baked oyster and baked mussel appetizers are great. For light eaters, the 3 small crabcake appetizer is fine. She crab soup is tasty, get the small one, very rich. The shrimp and scallop is a bit light for the price, 3 shrimp, 2 scallops. Service, was not impressive, water and ice team refills required flagging down a waiter. If the photos I submit stay attached to this review, take a look at the building shots, the place is hard to find and they have a very small sign.

Very nice place to spend an evening. The food is delicious, the waiters are attentive, and the location is really nice. I loved my scallops and shrimps, and my son's steak was great. The prices were also reasonable.
The only downside is the strong smell of seafood.

Just ate lunch here and it was amazing! The service was fast and the food was incredible at reasonable prices. We shared the lobster dip and I had the lunch special of the day which was grilled salmon over Brussels sprouts, goat cheese, and strawberries in an apple cider vinaigrette. This might be our new go to lunch spot!

The Hard Shell has a lovely setup! The atmosphere is light and great on a Sunday evening! A group of us experienced them for a birthday dinner. The food was good, the were minor adjustments needed, and a few of our meals had to much seasoning as we asked for our shrimp and scallops to be blackened. Our waitress was amazing and tended to our every need. Another staff assisted me with a different hand soap for the bathroom because the original one had an ingredient I'm allergic too. The only other thing to think about when planning your experience is keep in mind parking. Hope you enjoy your own experience!

We dined here on a Saturday night and choose to enjoy their lovely outdoor seating. Service was good and their bread service was respectable. My friend ordered a steak that was over cooked and I ordered the she crab soup and scallop appetizer for my dinner. The soup was bland AF but had a fair amount of lump crab. The scallops were amazing and the three you are served are worth the $15 price tag. One thing to note, while passing by the kitchen to use the restroom I heard a kitchen staff member (Caucasian male with a full on beard) berating the wait staff on their lack of speediness to deliver food. There is a way to go about motivating someone and away from customers is the first step. Other than the scallops The Hard Shell is average and I would not dine here again.

name: The Savory Grain
address: 2043 W Broad St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: This is the best bar and in my opinion the only one that means anything in Richmond. The fries were great and the whiskey was not watered down. They had a guitarist who had acoustic and electric solo act who was incredible! And the people beside us had the best smelling dish with artichoke hearts. Would stop here again in a ❤️ beat. Great service and bartender!!!

Lisa Adams reviewing. We had a business meeting here and it was great. We came in around 11:30 am and were seated in the back in a charming room that fit all 10 of us nicely. The menu is eclectic and since they make a lot of their food items fresh, it allowed me to ask for certain ingredients, which are not on my diet, to be withheld. They were quite accommodating. We had 3 appetizers with our meal and when we ran out of bread for our dip, they brought us more. Everyone seemed to enjoy their meals and the atmosphere. Parking at this time was easy. All in all, a wonderful experience.

Great food great service. They checked allergens for one of my friends. And made my sister's birthday party pretty awesome.

$5 burgers and bourbon. really awesome crab dip and Fried brussel sprouts as well.
Great food and beer selection.  Much better than typical bar food.
I ate here once.  The food is good.  I sat at a table and a person took my order.  I liked that too.

name: Millie's Diner
address: 2603 E Main St, Richmond, VA 23223, USA
reviews: Come on, Millie's has been a staple of Richmond for over 20 years at least.  have been multiple times.  Great food, made to order and always fresh.  Like that the menu changes, depending on what they are getting fresh that week.   The only really downfall that I can see is sometimes parking downtown and with a small cooking area, if they are busy food can take a little longer, but usually well worth the wait.  Thanks for good food through the years!

I came with my wife and brother in law and the food was great! I got the Castro mess which was basically pork, eggs, beans, green peppers and cheese with home fries. The meal was fantastic! My wife got the eggs Benny which was really good. I would highly recommend this place. It's a little small so seating could take some time. We showed up with our whole party and got seated right away. The service was good as well. If you're in the area and looking for a great brunch spot check this place out!

Our first time at Millie's was very good! We were promptly greeted in a friendly manner and seated quickly. Ally our server was great. I ordered the Eggs Benny with a side of grits. My friend ordered the Scrambled Eggs with Lobster. We split the Lemon Pound Cake & Lemon Curd. The food was delicious and we'll definitely return again.

First diner/brunch place that came on my search when I was in town. Don't underestimate the size and looks of this place. This small little joint understands what flavors and seasonings are! The potatoes are amazing! I would have order another plate of it if I wasn't already overweight. Definitely on my list of top notch brunch restaurants.

We were for team lunch and all of em like this small little cozy place tucked at end. Been here several times but for team it was mostly first for most of em. Food is really good, have to hit the place on time to avoid rush. They have street parking and also small dedicated parking right opposite over the hill adjacent to the gas station. I recommend this one and would go back soon.

name: Comfort
address: 200 W Broad St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews:
Great food! I loved the Mac and cheese and the tofu jambalaya. We went here with a work group and I don’t think anyone was disappointed. My husband loved the collard greens and the catfish. I also usually dislike okra (the texture is not my favorite) but the okra at Comfort was really good and crunchy. A really pleasant surprise.
(My only gripe would be that there was no changing table in the bathroom. My 4 month old and I made do with what was there, but it definitely took some finagling. I acknowledge that we’re probably not the target demographic but still it’s good to know if you have a baby with you and are going out in an attempt to feel like an adult person.)
I will be sad to say goodbye to this RVA Institution.  That and all the good that Jason & Michelle have done for the community.

Excellent fried catfish and veggies—including sweet-sour collards I could not stop eating, which is saying a lot for collards.  Our daughter works at a highly rated BBQ restaurant and she liked the pulled pork. The cornbread was not appealing at first but with butter is actually very good and is probably more authentic than the sweet, cake-y stuff we are used to. Velveeta fans will like the mac and cheese but it was not to our taste.  We stayed at the Quirk and Comfort is right across the street

One word, Butter! I could taste it in all the food it was so delicious. Even the broccoli was covered in some butter. The corn bread was to die for. The staff was wonderful the restaurant was cute, I love how they serve their water in Mason jars.  The only complaint I have is with any restaurant, I am trying to watch my sugar intake and if the servers wouldn't take it so personally if I only asked for water. I get it you want to make as much money as possible in a restaurant and some customers are cheep, but please don't give anyone an awful look when they ask for water only. You don't know if they trying to watch out for there health.
Was excited to share in the farewell dinner. Jason was a gracious host and every single bite of food was wonderful. What a beautiful send-off!

name: East Coast Provisions
address: 3411 W Cary St, Richmond, VA 23221, USA
reviews: Great place for seafood. Service was wonderful. They take reservations and the atmosphere is warm and inviting.

I did not take pics of the entrees but the Burrata was absolutely perfect. The tomato jam brought the perfect amount of acidity and slight sweetness, the nuttiness from the pistachios were an outstanding touch and the slight bite from the micro greens really rounded things out. An absolute must try!
We had a quiet corner upstairs, where we were able to have conversation. The food was good, and I especially enjoyed the colorful and fresh vegetables that garnished the plate.

My very first time here. We had a small family gathering of eight of us and we all seemed to get something different. All the plates were empty, even after the large servings you receive. I had the simple egss, bacon, toast and potatoes. I eat my eggs sunny side up and they were perfect. The potatoes were delicious and the bacon scrumptious. I will definitely be back.

Solid seafood spot sporting seasonal specials, spirits and such. Miso crab soup was a nicely rich entreé to more substantial dishes. Octopus was pretty good (mind the garlic) but the star on my visit was the PEI Mussels. Perfect. *ask for the bread grilled to hell and back tho*

name: The Tobacco Company Restaurant
address: 1201 E Cary St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews:
I like going here after work. The bartender, Kelly, tries to really connect with frequent customers and I appreciate that! I’ve actually mentioned to her at work and others have mentioned how hospitable she is to them as well. The other bartenders are really amazing as well, but Kelly always seems to go above and beyond.
Drinks are great...food is eh....but I’m usually only here for drinks.
Food was good.  Needs some additional vegetarian entree options.

I’ll start off by echoing the usual comments about the decor and atmosphere, this is an amazing place. I had nothing but great and attentive service the whole time as well. Great bartenders and one of the better martinis I’ve ever had. 
I was very surprised with the food, some people have told me that this is the part that is somewhat lacking but that was not my case. The salad and apps were amazing, and I had some of the best crab cakes ever. Tons of lump crab meat. My wife had a filet which was perfectly cooked and I had a few bites, it was a stellar steak. 
This makes a great place for a special event or date.

Beautiful and historical, 2 of my favorite combos. Staff is friendly and take time to walk around and check on the tables. The food was incredible, I had salmon and my friend had NY Strip. My friend asked for his meat to be rare. Initially he received a piece that was cooked too much. They took it back no questions asked and gave him a whole new piece, sides included again as well. He said it was the best piece of steak he ever had and it cut through like butter. Manager came by to check on the 2nd cut as well. Very happy that I got to experience a place of our history with amazing friends and food.

Great place.  Drinks, light fare and ambience is some of the best in the city.  Courtney was very patient and accommodating to our group but I am disappointed in her not stopping my mother from attempting to embarrass me during my birthday through the band that night. Ha Will definitely swing by on my next stop in Richmond.

name: LEVEL Restaurant & Bar
address: 2007 W Broad St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: Amazing vibe, really good drink choices. A little small so plan a reservation or sit at the bar. I'm a bar goer myself so the bar is just at good. The food is really well done and cooked pretty good, good flavors and good portions. Check this place out for a good date night In the RVA. Top place here in this beautiful city
Best place in Richmond to eat sushi. They have a very cool bar, and the best staff they could buy. If you want fish in your mouth this is a place to go.

Cool sushi place in downtown Richmond. We ate there while in town visiting. The ambience is cool including a bar that lights up when you touch it. The sushi was very good although it took quite a while to get it. Overall we were pleased and would return.
The food was fresh and tasty. They had a variety of options. My daughter is a picky eater and she also enjoyed the food. The restaurant had a nice atmosphere as well. Will definitely go again.
I don't know how other sushi places exist when you can go to Level. It's the best.

name: Kitchen 64
address: 3336 N Arthur Ashe Blvd, Richmond, VA 23227, USA
reviews: Stopped off here on our way north as it was highly reviewed and near the highway. It did not disappoint as it is very much an established local favorite. The food was delicious and service was great. It is a funky old style dinner with a huge menu selection. They have their own off street parking.

Ample parking, Spacious and clean restaurant. Menu has a large selection. I opted for the sliders with cheese on a bed of fries. I was not impressed. The fries felt like there was no potato inside, and the burgers tasted like White Castle. The pickles were great. I wish I had opted for something else. The nachos seemed appetizing. 
The friend I went with loved his burger of the day with fries.  The waitstaff is very friendly and attentive. 
Overall, not a “knock my socks off” experience. It was just average.

This was our first time here. The food was good but the service was slow. No clean tables when we walked in. We were told to sit down at any table, so had to choose a dirty table and ask for it to be cleaned. It wasn't busy for a weekday so not sure why it was so slow to get service. I had the grilled zucchini and tomato sandwich which was delicious and my daughter had the pizza. It was okay. Bottom of pizza was soggy. We will try it again next time on that side of town.
We came during the weekend for brunch. It's a nice location close to museums and the stadium. Price is right and the quantity was surprisingly generous. We will definitely come again.

At first glance, this seems like a small, hole-in-wall place.  Done be fooled....this place is excellent.  I ordered the lamb chops, and I was very impressed. I am fairly picky about my meat and can't stand it overcooked.  They did a great job cooking it how I wanted.  It was moist and tender.  As well, the mixed vegetables were perfect. I live squash and zucchini, but I hate it when restaurants serve them over cooked, soggy and mushy.  These were nicely done, yet firm and crisp.  The staff was very pleasant and helpful.  I enjoyed my dinner and will definitely be back.

name: Lunch. | Supper!
address: 1213 Summit Ave, Richmond, VA 23230, USA
reviews: Had the Pickle and Fried Chicken Sandwich, friends had the Lions Den- both were delicious! Loved the outside covered area, beer garden. Will be back!

Food was amazing. The drinks also hit the spot and we're very tasty. Lots of variety to choose from for everyone. The dinner side has the same menu as lunch, however, somethings were not included for breakfast/brunch time. Limited seating in both buildings, but there is an outside area to enjoy drinks.

First visit, and I believe I was seated on the "lunch" side which is the smaller dining room to the right.   Got there around 2pm on a Saturday and it was busy but was able to be seated within 5 minutes.   Had the pork rinds and dip for an app and they were pretty good.  My entree was the Ferrytown sandwich, as I recall.   It was short rib meat topped with a small amount of macaroni and an onion ring.  Unique, but not all that great tasting.  The Texas toast bread was actually the best part.  Bathroom was tiny, had no paper towels.  Parking is a challenge.

Showing my 22yr old niece Richmond and we stopped at Lunch, for lunch.  She thought it was one of the best meals she has ever had.  Atmosphere is great, we sat outside, had some good drinks and she tried some Ruby Red Moonshine, which she loved.  4 of us and we all enjoyed our meals.  I thought they had some very unique and southern blended menu items, like the pork rinds nachos, I want to give them a try.  Staff was attentive and friendly.  Will be going again.

Winner! For lunch we shared some apps that were beyond good. Service was friendly, informed and spot on. Dinner has been excellent in the past and there is no disappointment for lunch. Treat yourself and friends. It is wonderful.

name: ZZQ Texas Craft Barbeque
address: 3201 W Moore St, Richmond, VA 23230, USA
reviews: Food was amazing. The options are great for whatever you want. Even the sides that we had were good. Everyone was very nice and welcoming as well. Will definitely be back to try some other meats with some more brisket.

Best Brisket I've ever had! Collards were extremely flavorful and delicious. Red cabbage slaw was crunchy and fresh. Jalapeno mac & cheese was Awesome. I'm sure everyone in town already knows how good the food is, the other stand out is how well thought out this concept is. There is a cafeteria style serving line where guests can see how fresh and high quality the food is before purchasing. Free loaf bread is available to enjoy with your meal. At the end of the serving line I paid for my food and the cashier offered to leave my tab open so I could get drinks from the bar, so I didn't have to run multiple tabs. Within 10 minutes of entering I had my food, my drinks, a clean table, and was enjoying myself in a warm upbeat environment. The only thing I think ZZQ could do better would be to offer some more kid friendly options, my son felt like the mac & cheese was too spicy.(it's not that spicy) I went back to the serving line for a few more pieces of loaf bread and put some brisket on it and that was good for him. Great food, great experience, five stars, definitely going back.

Incredible experience front to back. Being greeted at the door by one of the owners and having the process explained is truly a great opening hand. Drinks are offered while you wait in the long (without fail) line. Once you get to the counter, the staff are all smiles and offer samples for some of the dishes. Everything was delicious, tender, and flavorful. Quite easily the best barbecue I've ever had in my entire life. Believe the hype.

I'm going to make this simple. ZZQ has the best brisket of all time. Not even exaggerating. Super nice spot with indoor and outdoor seating. They gave us samples of the brisket while we were in line. One of the owners stopped and spoke to us while we were waiting, and checked in on everybody in the dining room. Really enjoyed ourselves. They also have a well stocked bar with plenty of good spirits. If you're in Richmond and love BBQ this should be your first stop. Get there early though. The word is out and you don't want to get there after they run out. This place is so good we actually heard about it on a radio station in DC!

The food here is hands down delicious. They know how to handle the meats. We drove really fast to get there... because that's just how good it is. Lines out the door.. but the wait is more than worth it. A little pricey $$$. About $20 a person.

name: Sabai
address: 2727 W Broad St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: Went for a late night drink and was blown away! Limited late night options but the calamari was perfect as well as the tangy sauce that went with it. The vibe on the inside is very chill and peaceful. Nice place to sit and have a good conversation with a friend. I had the "what lurks beneath". Be prepared to drop some good money on your drink but the presentation and quality is well worth it.

Delightfully fresh Thai food on Broad Street. The curries were incredible, as was the decor... fresh plants dripping from the industrial ceiling, accented by tons of bright wood tables and seating. Staff was friendly and fast. I can’t recommend this place enough!

Excellent service waiter was very responsive to whatever we needed. Atmosphere is airy and hip lots of cool plants hanging around and they have a swinging table which is unique.
