Food comes in huge portions two people could probably split one thing unless you’re in collage and broke then you might wanna order two. Bathrooms are really cool and you can just tell in general that they put a lot of effort into the small things in this restaurant. Was very impressed and would absolutely return.

Probably one of the best Thai food places I have had in Virginia and definitely the best in Richmond. 🤩 

Beautiful ambience, street views are amazing, terrific spicy basil fried rice and delicious ginger chicken

This was my first time trying Thai food and boy they did not disappoint! I loved it all. The service, the vibe and the food were great! They have a parking lot but it's small but there are places to park that is in walking distance. I will be going back!

name: Wong Gonzalez
address: 412 E Grace St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: What a cool place! I can definitely say I've never tried anything like it and was not disappointed. They had a pretty large selection of drinks and the house margaritas still seemed very high quality. The food was really good and had a nice balance of the Latin and Asian flavors.

Excellent all around experience. Friendly and attentive service, straightforward menu and ordering process. Food did not take long to come out. We got the fried chicken burrito and the bulgogi burrito. Highly recommended, will be coming back.

I hate we popped in here for a quick lunch, because  I would have enjoyed staying a while and people watching.   My food was delicious and the service was quite enjoyable.   My cocktail was just what the doctor ordered on this busy day.  Absolutely take the time to read the whole menu before ordering because there are so many yummy options and you can’t go wrong with the specials.  
Definitely will enjoy Wong Gonzalez again the next time I’m in Richmond.
Xoxo Lorenzo

The food is amazing!!! So many options and small enough to try a few different things. Also very reasonable prices and it's such a nice atmosphere. It is a small place so reservations are the way to go but a seat at the bar was cozy and perfect.
Tacos pretty good. The old fashioned was one of the best. They offer Blanton's!

name: Ipanema Cafe
address: 917 W Grace St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: We stopped in as we were passing through town and my partner and I really enjoyed our experience. The food was great. The menu was clear and easy to understand what was vegan and what was vegetarian (those vegetarian items are all possible to be made vegan). They were sadly out of some really attractive menu options that night but it was late and understandable. Service was very nice and friendly. We felt very cozy in the space too. Great for long dinners and conversations.

Cool underground atmosphere at night. Helpful staff, and very accommodating for vegan and gluten free needs. The food is a bit expensive and tastes good... For vegan food.

Pictured is the sweet potato fries, the okonomiyaki-style vegetable pancake (I would recommend this), and an oyster-mushroom steak (would not recommend this).

Extra tidbit: Ipanema is the name of a neighborhood in Rio, and the restaurant bears the name because the owner liked the song "Girl from Ipanema"

A vegetarian and vegan eatery that is always a good trip. It is situated in a basement and on the VCU campus and a consistently rotating menu. Portions are a little small but they will always be good! I strongly recommend getting a pot of the vanilla tea to go with your meal too! They will drop off a whole kettle and small cups so you can keep refilling.

Cool, lowly lit inside with booths and nice bar area. I’m a carnie and thought the food was fantastic. Recommend the jackfruit mushroom dip and the Beyond Burger. Went for lunch on a Thursday and easily got a seat.

I was welcomed warmly by the hostess as soon as I entered into this hidden gem. With my new years resolution of eating better it was great to find a vegetarian place that was affordable. I came alone and was greeted by the bartender who was very friendly while I sipped on the delicious house red wine. I ordered a beyond burger with sweet potato fries and they were both cook immaculately and soothed my taste buds. While eating the owner stopped by and asked about my experience and started a brief conversation with me which made me feel like family. I will for sure be back for more in the future. The atmosphere, food, drinks, and staff were splendid and made my evening amazing. Thank you Inpanema.

name: Maple & Pine Restaurant
address: 201 W Broad St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: The setting is amazing. Lots of nice people around. The food was ok service was excellent. If you have a first date, this is definitely the place to come. I would definitely be coming back for the food and the setting. Also you can go up to the rooftop for a cocktail and the ambiance is like Miami.

Nice, bougie place. The decor is very nice and the food and service is also good. If we are talking fine dining in Richmond  there are better options for better food. You just have to know why you are coming to Maple and Pine for.

I’ve been here numerous times and always received great service and food but didn’t know they could do even better! I made a reservation for my friend’s birthday the day of and they made a special menu for her with champagne waiting and it truly made her and my day! The staff were friendly and the food was amazing. I was already planning to return but I may have to make this place a part of my routine because the service was phenomenal. Thank you all for an amazing time! We all plan to return soon.

Maple & Pine Restaurant, located in the Quirk Hotel, was a great experience. The ambiance is more reminiscent of a restaurant in Miami Beach than Richmond. It made me feel right at home. A simple and affordable one page menu, which had a nice selection of paninis, entrees, salads and starters, made selection a breeze. I had the chicken curry and noodles, which had spices and hints of coconut. I will definitely visit again and highly recommend to others.

I wouldn't go there again for a romantic dinner for two, since it is a busy lobby/bar with close seating arrangement. Also the doors are a little drafty. But the food was great and reasonable priced. Staff was nice as well.

name: Cafe Rustika
address: 414 E Main St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: Pleasantly pleased!  Space is small but warm and cozy with a relaxed, friendly atmosphere.  Food was delicious and German authentic.  I had marinated beef with egg noodles and cucumber salad and was blown away.  The beef was melt in your mouth out of this world and I could slice with my fork.  The egg noodles were spectacular for just being egg noodles and butter and the cucumber salad was just as good!  Good wine and beer selection. Oh, and the home made bread is excellent!
The reviews did not disappoint. European pub ambience, delightful German beer and food. Sumptuous serving sizes as well. The sides were just as good as entrees

First time dining here, and it was a great. Small place with limited seating however its cozy. They have a nice beer and wine selection. We had the schnitzel with a couple sides. The food was very authentic German. The meals are very reasonably priced. I definitely will back. Thanks Mike.

From the moment I walked in the door, I knew I would love this place. Met with a warm welcome and a sense of pride for the culinary delights I was about to experience. Solid selection of German imports and wine to start. The menu is full of all the favorites and everything sounds delicious. The portions are overly generous and full of flavor. I would have no problem saying this is the best German food in Richmond, and probably the region.

German food in the heart of Richmond! They have several different schnitzel options as well as other items (bratwurst, sausages, etc) that we found to be very good. The schnitzel can be pork, chicken, or veal depending on what you like. The only vegetarian main was a spatzel option that is basically “German mac and cheese” it is a lot of the same flavor by itself but also pretty delicious.

name: Little Nickel
address: 4702 Forest Hill Ave, Richmond, VA 23225, USA
reviews: I'm in love! The menu here is obviously created by a true "foodie" - the flavor combinations are spectacular! If you haven't tried eating here yet, do yourself a favor and go right now! We've only been once, but we have vowed to keep going back until we've tried everything on the menu.

What a gem that Richmond has gained! From the cocktails to the appetizers and desserts to the entrees, I was beyond impressed with what Little Nickel brought to the table. The shining star of this place, besides the incredibly friendly staff, is the remarkable attention to detail in the restaurant decor. It was adorable, lux and weaved such a lovely vibe. You should just drop everything and go here now. You won’t regret it!

An eclectic restaurant in both style and substance, with a creative, tasty menu, fast and friendly service, and affordable prices (though drinks can add up quick). The menu seems to find inspiration from all corners of the world, and you're bound to find something tasty and inspiring here. The kids menu is a bit typical, which is probably a good thing because your kid will need to have a willingness to push their boundaries if they will be sharing a plate with you. The service is awesome. A 10 minute wait was really 2, and our waitress made sure my daughter had crayons and was overall just wonderfully nice. The food came out quick, was hot and delicious, and portions were giant. Everything we had was great. The restaurant is decorated with an island retro flair. You'll find lots to look at. The bar is particularly interesting. Overall, great!

Little Nickel is unashamed of their love of Hawaiian shirts. You have to appreciate that!  Everything I tried was thoughtfully flavorful and delicious.  I’m still thinking about the special from last night: fried risotto balls with a roasted pepper sauce.

This definitely a spot to check out. It's warm  and quaint with an eclectic vibe. Although slightly pricey, they have fun drinks.  The food is delicious, the portions are generous and curiously better prices than the drinks in my opinion. The staff listens and caters to the patron's need. If you are looking for a new fun place to dine in Richmond, check them out.

name: Peter Chang
address: 2816 W Broad St A, Richmond, VA 23230, USA
reviews: The food is just fantastic! They have a lot of unique in new variations on the Chinese food. Most is served family style so it's kind of cool that everyone can order something different and then you can try different things. The staff is very helpful in selecting in answering any questions. The food comes extremely quick, except for a few things. We ordered some soup bones and the waitress told us they would take about 20 minutes for them to come out. I've been here a few times I've always enjoyed the food, and haven't had a bad experience yet. Would highly recommend!

Food tasted great and the restaurant had a good vibe.  The menu was smaller than the one in Williamsburg but still good.  I took 2 stars away because of parking. There is about 4 spots in front but if you don't get those wear walking shoes and don't park in the empty lot next door because they tow or charge $10

This place has flavorful and unique foods. Everything is not only beautifully seasoned but also well presented. The meat eaters of the group strongly recommend the crispy pork belly appetizer, and we all loved the novelty of the bubble pancake.

We moved here from Northern Va a year ago and tried Scots edition Peter Chang. So good!  The menu recently changed and there seems to be way fewer options, which is fine. I like that anything on the menu (just about) can be made gluten free. The restaurant interior decor is colorful, vibrant, and festive, and they also offer quick and easy take out if you prefer.
I love this restaurant. The food is amazing. Friendly servers, clean environment, and delicious food. What more could you ask for? Have a blessed day....

name: Morton's The Steakhouse
address: 111 Virginia St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews:
Mary and I enjoyed the entire dining experience. Our server was excellent. The dishes were delicious. The ambiance... what can I say... it's Morton's! You pay for the ambiance and it's worth it.
I hope we can return soon. Life is short - so enjoy it!

Ordered the Easter special for takeout and it was delicious. The filet and lobster tail were excellent and the creamed spinach and shrimp cocktail portions were huge. Alex took my order over the phone earlier in the day and it was ready later in the day when I arrived to pick it up. Alex brought the order out to my truck and I was on my way.  Can’t wait to return when my wife and I can enjoy the entire restaurant experience.

I made reservations to celebrate my birthday and engagement. They made special menus and took pictures. They moved the table so we didn't have to slide into the booth. Warm greetings all night. The waitress knew the menu and the steak was the best we ever ate. We will definitely return to this location. Loved the ambiance.

Lived up to expectations. Despite having a glass of wine spilled by the server (quickly replaced), and a bit of a delay on dessert (prompt dessert drinks), it was spectacular. Knowledgeable courteous wait staff, perfectly seasoned and prepared dishes. The price and experience are intertwined.

We ordered take out Easter Sunday. What a staggering disappointment. The cost was $175 for meal for 4. Creamed spinach, potatoes au grotten,  2 small Caesar salads, 2 small steaks, a new York strip and lamb medallions, 4 cheesecake slices. Hardly enough food for 4 people. Worst of all the steaks and lamb were raw. Had to be cooked! We had to order pizza to feed everyone. Never again.

name: True's Cultural Kitchen
address: 415 W Grace St ste a, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: I tried this spot after hearing about their vegan options through social media. I was not disappointed. I got the curried potatoes and chickpeas. A little hot! But delicious. What I’m here to spread the good word about, though, is THAT SPINACH PATTY. That was the best thing I’ve ever put in my mouth! Perfectly chewy but crispy patty, filled with deliciously cooked spinach. The perfect balance of spices and texture. They KILLED IT. I want to eat 5 for every meal. I can’t wait to go back. Last but not least, the hospitality is outstanding. I’ve communicated with the owner over social media and have been astounded by the responsiveness, honesty, and gratitude. I am so happy to support this local spot.

First impressions mean a lot and True's Cultural Kitchen gets 5 stars in every category!!! The customer service is by far the best I've had in a long time. The young woman taking our "to go" order explained there was only one cook today and there would be a slight wait...others that were waiting longer than I, were offered free beverages.  She was courteous and responsive, nicely dressed, too.  The place was clean and neat.  The food was absolutely Amazing!!  I ordered a vegan dish called Honey Hennessy Stir Fry...sooo delicious. My friend had the Veggie Tacos, which looked out of this world scrumptious!!!  I will certainly be a regular 🤗🤗🤗🤗🤗

I’ve always had a FANTASTIC experience at True’s. The staff is always friendly, the food is out of this world amazing, and the drinks are delicious. What more could you ask for? As a person who is leaning more towards plant based options, trues has an amazing selection of vegan foods which are delicious. The stir fry, the salmon, the patties...everything I’ve tried has been a hit.

I had my first experience with True’s cultural kitchen at the Stick a Fork in it event this weekend. I have sadly been missing out of this gem since it opened and I have truly been missing out. As a vegan, I was excited to see a variety of plant-based options available. And it did not disappoint, the vegan Mac and the African fried spinach were a delicious experience and I hope these items will be a mainstay on the menu. I look forward to the next opportunity to visit True’s Cultural Kitchen and allow my taste buds to be blessed again!
The food was made to order and very fresh. All of our entrees and sides had really good flavor and was not salty👍🏽. I look forward to trying more entrees the next time.

name: Helen’s Restaurant
address: 2527 W Main St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: I stumbled across this place by one happy accident and I will forever be grateful Brunch was packed and it was raining. I ordered the chicken biscuit and it was so delicious I had some sort of out of body experience where I forgot where I was and showed zero shame whilst licking my fingers in the middle of a crowded restaurant. It's the perfect blend of sweet, savory and spicy. It's heaven. The curry potatoes are perfectly spiced. The service is the perfect blend of attentive and leave you alone. The guys in the kitchen are insanely talented and focused. With good reason, the food coming out of it is perfection. 20/10 will totally go again!
Fantastic, super cute, delicious. Had the bay Benedict and my eggs were perfect. Curry potatoes were also so good. Highly recommend

It was little things that spoiled the visit. No one seemed to be in charge of greeting and seating guests. We were seated quickly after I asked.The Breakfast BLT was fine as were the curried potatoes. The The Chicken Biscuit was not. A thin piece of chicken stuck in the middle of lots of breading which was fried just shy of inedible.  Plus the honey pepper bacon was so heavy on the black pepper that I could still taste it 15 minutes later.  Two sandwiches and one glass of ice tea for $29 would feel a little high under normal circumstances. When one of the sandwiches was was as poor as this one, we weren't impressed. Nothing wrong with the vibe or the decor, but with as many choices as there are in RVA, it's not likely we'll be back.

I had a $14 tab.  I had a $50 bill I needed to break.  It was a Friday night.  They couldn't break it.  I paid for my tab on my card and they gave me $25 back.  They basically stole $25 from me.  I didn't tip because of that. I'm never going back

My friend and I went here on the 11th of March, around 8pm. We walk in, request a booth and the waiter (male, around 25 or so) immediately told us we couldn't have a booth because it was for dinners only. We didnt even get the chance to tell him we wanted food too. Naybe he got the impression we were there to drink and nothing else, that wasn't the case at all. No big deal, we said we'd sit on the bar side. He wouldn't even guide us to a table or tell us to sit where we wanted. The whole time his body language was very hostile, he was abrupt and rude. We ordered a drink but decided to go someplace else where the atmosphere wasn't so negative.

Maybe he has person things going on at home, or maybe his previous guests were rude and he was projecting his anger. Regardless, the way he treated us was unacceptable. We won't be going back, there are ample amounts of restaurants in Carytown. You lost a potential regular customer that night.

name: McLeans Restaurant
address: 3205 W Broad St, Richmond, VA 23230, USA
reviews: So my order was given to someone else and I still can’t understand because when you call in an order they take your name and also they charge way to many taxes to customers one in particular being the carry out tax which I feel since it is not an option to dine in at this time the customer shouldn’t have to be taxed. I cannot wait for City Diner to reopen. Good food, fast service at good prices. BRUNCH is my number one favorite but they are also closed.
The food was delicious!!  Well seasoned and good sized portions.  Efficient and kind staff.👍🏽🍽🥰  And seated within 5 minutes.  We should have been in sooner, but we'll be back often!!
Great food, kind and friendly staff. Very welcoming atmosphere!  We had a small group  and everyone was very accommodating.  Great experience overall, we'll keep coming back!
Great local gem, food is good and service is always above and beyond

Elaine placed several orders for me over the phone. She was very polite and accurate. When I arrived the food was ready and I was in and out.... she’s a great asset to your team... food was delicious as well...

name: Alewife
address: 3120 E Marshall St, Richmond, VA 23223, USA
reviews: We have been to Alewife a handful of times without making a reservation. Talk about getting lucky multiple times with walking into a table that just emptied or an open spot at the bar!! If you want to experience this awesome restaurant and don't want to take any chances MAKE A RESERVATION. I say that because Alewife is no longer a secret and everyone knows the quality of this place. The dishes and cocktails are fresh, tasty and well prepared!! The staff is always on point and Alewife's menu and drink list has looked amazing every time we have gone in. The plating of Alewife's dishes are always beautifully done and the food tastes like perfection! We must return after this pandemic.

We went to this cool restaurant on Easter Sunday last year and our meal was divine. The service was pleasant, efficient and not too over the top. Love the open concept and the ability to see the chef at work. I have missed being able to go into the restaurant and can’t wait to return as soon as possible.

Had a great meal here with my wife.  We had a table in the window, prompt & professional service & perfectly paced delivery.  The food was fantastic.  The menu is seasonal and always changing. They had seven non-alcoholic beverage options on their bar menu!

I don't know where to start with Alewife. The reviews have been expansive in their praise for Chef Lee's latest project and we went with high expectations. After loving The Roosevelt and Southbound, we hoped Alewife would live up. As usual, Lee's creativity was the surprising thing. He's taken the menu in a different direction but the common thread with the other projects is that creativity. We had an array of appetizers and then somehow managed main dishes too, with some effort as we had already tried so many amazing things. It's so new but it looks like it will be a neighborhood gem for years to come. The recipe is fresh fresh fresh, Chesapeake, Virginia, fresh again, with a heavy dose of creative. 5 stars.

First of all Tony and Andon at the bar were superb! Blown away! This place rocks! Great vibes. The food is amazing! The crab claws, tomato salad, shrimp and oysters were outstanding! One of the FEW 5 star reviews. Its takes a lot to get 5 real stars and Lee Gregory gets them all. The staff was great, food out of this world. Fried oysters to die for! Homemade hot sauce that stays with you. AMAZING!

name: Parterre Restaurant
address: 100 E Franklin St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: I attended a conference at the convention center fall 2019 and enjoyed dinner by myself at Parterre afterward. Of course, the Poe reference on the sidewalk chalkboard piqued my interest! It is comfortable and at the same time clean and sophisticated. I was greeted promptly for dinner. I have special dietary needs and they were able to advise me on what I could eat on the menu. The menu was a mix of modern and classics. I had a well seasoned shrimp and grits and iced tea. I would definitely eat here again if I'm in downtown Richmond for lunch or dinner :)

Pretty setting and prices were good. The dish we ordered was not good. Sausage gravy was under seasoned. The tater tots were over seasoned (too salty). The egg was ordered over easy and came out overcooked and rubbery. The menu states two biscuits with the sausage gravy. It looked like one cut in half. Waitress was nice, and did take the egg off the bill.

Good evening I just needed to say that Parterre Restaurant is absolutely excellent hospitality so friendly and very welcoming this morning I came in for coffee they were so sweet and kind I asked them about their menu as I was waiting they explain the menu you showed me the menu so I was able to come other times to explore their wonderful Hospitality with the other menus lunch and dinner looks like Excellent food on both of the they seem to have almost everything you would want to try and I had the opportunity to to experience the Hospitality with Celeste 👌🏾and Jess👌🏾 absolutely warm and inviting Wonderful Hospitality I came back and had an appetizer and drink this morning I got veggie wrap it was actually made with tofu and it was delicious with vegetables peppers and onions and so forth and potatoes delicious please come and try them you will always come back the place is so cozy the decor is absolutely beautiful beautiful wood decoreven if it's a beautiful day you have outside patio which is absolutely beautiful as well just so inviting Love love love 🙏🏾💝🤗👌🏾

I stopped in for an early afternoon meal with my wife. We live in the neighborhood, but it was our first time visiting. It won't be our last. Everything that we had was fantastic. The entire staff was warm and inviting. I was really impressed with the happy hour selections. What a great place.

This place is awesome. I frequent this outstanding hotel the Lindon Row Inn that resides adjacent to this restaraunt.  The strawberry pound cake coffee is very good.  Admittedly I do not smell strawberries.  After plunging my epinephrine into my thigh due to an allergy to strawberries.... I tried the red wine.  Unfortunately grapes and strawberries reside in the same family.  Just kidding.  This place has great charm and street access close to broad street.  Very good food.  The fried chicken looks like a turkey dinner.  The staff is very friendly.  And we can all confess that this is what's missing from good service.  Combined with quality it's a refreshing experience.  No hipster douches or beef tartar here.

name: Brunch...
address: 2600 W Main St, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: I went to Brunch for the first time today and LOVED my meal. I was pleasantly surprised by the amount and kinds of breakfast they offered. The space was lively and full of plants! The food was delicious; I had the Happy Herbivore bowl and a side of the seasonal fruit with a cup of coffee. I loved every bite! The staff was kind and helpful as well!

Very good atmosphere. Sitting up towards the front where the sunlight can come in the skylight makes it even better. We of course had brunch and it was superb! I ordered the Waffle Flight because I couldn't pick just one of the types that they offered. I also had a side of Breakfast Sausage. The waffles were amazing and each came with a sample of the butter or syrup they are normally served with. This was definitely a pleasant twist on a typical breakfast staple. They even managed to revamp the typical sausage links. The breakfast sausage was clearly hand made ground sausage made into patties. If I am visiting Richmond again this place will definitely be one of my stops! Don't think twice. Just do it!

Possibly the best breakfast in Richmond. I went with my wife for a breakfast in honor of a special day. Everything we ordered was delicious and well presented. I had the waffle flight and an espresso drink. The drink was well made with art and the waffles were well presented and delicious. It's a pretty popular place so you might have to wait 15 minutes or so to get a seat. The staff is friendly, well trained, and courteous. I definitely recommend this for any of your needs for a great breakfast.

Killer pancakes and Monte Cristo, with a delightful atmosphere and wonderfully helpful and attentive staff. The mimosas are splendid and the food is delicious. Highly recommended, but do prepare to wait on a Sunday morning

We went for brunch and I had a party of 7 and a hour wait and I would wait an hour again!!!! The service was awesome the food was amazing. Ms. Jacqueline helped our party get seated and Luke was our server. His recommendations for our meal was EVERYTHING! It was our first time in this wonderful resturant so we asked a million questions and he answered all with no problems. He told us his favorite dishes and he was spot on about everything. I plan on going back really soon and bringing more friends. This was such a wonderful dining experience!

name: Restaurant Adarra
address: 618 N 1st St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews:
Experience: Home-run both time we were there. 👍🏼

Located in Jackson ward, close to the art infused neighborhoods along W Broad St, Restaurant Adarra feels like a house on the street that happens to serve food. It’s presence highlighting the sense of community that you see in many places around Richmond (think Sub Rosa on Churchill).

On the eye: Being Basque-inspired meant some of the menus are tapa-like — in smaller bowls and plates that forms a picture of adventure, bringing delight for the diner. Colors are never dull nor added without purpose, most distinct would be the different peppers and beans.

Taste: labeled as Modern European, it shakes off any potential “New American” branding in its carefully curated dishes — crafting flavors that are unique to the region and yet carries with it an air of creativity. Many bringing out wonderful flavors without being stingy on the portion, allowing you to taste and fully enjoy each plate.

Drinks: Cava is the “champagne” of the land and it’s presence is indicative of their priority — a drink menu focused on imports from Spain that draws a great authentic undertone for the meal.

Service: The service were casual yet confident. On both visits we were impressed by the knowledge of the server with both the food and drink menus. It’s hard to miss their pride in the restaurant and all that it provides.

Definitely a gem in Richmond.

Celebrated a birthday dinner on a Saturday night.  Our meal was excellent, more enjoyable while sharing.  Service was slightly under expectations, and just shy of attentive.  It took a good 10 minutes before a server approached us for drink orders and also rambled unintelligibly though the specials, my partner had to ask for a refill of a beverage twice, and it was noticeable that regular patrons received a ton of attention but the rest of us not so much.  But generally, we had a good experience.

We had an excellent dinner at Restaurant Adarra. The menu is made up of small plates that can be shared. This is great as it allows you to try multiple things from the menu. We had a group of four and got to sample a pretty good portion of the dishes. The flavors were amazing and everything was pretty good. The skate and rabbit really stood out in particular.

While I was extremely pleased with the food, the cocktails were possibly even more impressive. The Little Italy was my favorite, by far, but I would highly recommend talking to the bartender about what kinds of things you like and then letting him come up with a concoction based upon those preferences. I tried a few different things and liked them all. the bartender was very knowledgeable and seemed to be able to get a good feel of what I would enjoy.

The restaurant is very small, so reservations might be hard to come by, especially on short notice. This isn't usually an issue for us as we enjoy sitting at the bar. However, the night we were there, they were giving out the corner section of the bar as a reservation. This really cuts down on the number of bar seats available for walk-ups and was an unwelcome surprise. Definitely not a deal-breaker, but something to be aware of if you can't get a reservation and it looks like there might be space at the bar.

Overall, we had a great time and would definitely return.
Super food, great decor and atmosphere. Staff and owners were friendly and great. One of the best in Richmond. Can’t recommend enough! Will be back for sure.
Chef Doetzer never disappoints. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Make sure to ask for the perfect wine for pairing

name: Perch
address: 2918 W Broad St, Richmond, VA 23230, USA
reviews: Amazing service!  Sunday Brunch was a wonderful experience.  Brought a group of friends to celebrate one of their birthday.  The chef cooked an awesome non menu item special for her and it was incredible.   Everyone else ordered from the menu and the food did not disappoint.  Live tiki lounge music was great and relaxing.  Great time!

Fantastic cocktails and fancy menu. Hip space up front but the back room (which may be good for a small party) doesn’t have the same vibe - feels a bit stuffier and more old fashioned than the vibrant front area. Got the heirloom tomato salad and PayPal salad - both lacked greens. Probably overlooked that on the menu but it was a bit unexpected. Great interior design and service was pretty good.

If I could give 6 stars  I would. The food was fantastic; the servers were amazing. In addition, I have multiple food allergies (soy, dairy & gluten). When I arrived, I told them the allergies. When I sat down, they brought over a customized menu which included the chefs adaptations to remove any of my allergens. No restaurant has ever been able to customize so many menu items. I was in food heaven!  An unquestionably delicious meal.

Oh my! There are no words to describe the culinary genius that is PERCH but I will try. We had the whole fish and the special, rock fish. The flavors were amazing, they just exploded on your tongue! The decor is very pleasing to the eye and it compliments the type of food beautifully. My advice is to make time and eat at PERCH! We are praying that Perch will expand and come to Charlotte. Until then we will have to visit Richmond more often!

Each time I come to Perch, the experience amazes me. The first time we sat at the chefs table and were treated to several things to try, a lovely conversation with the chef and the folks working in the kitchen, and were served amazing food (the duck pizza, calamari, oysters were all incredible). The second time was for a friends birthday and again, the chef and staff treated us like we were royalty. They gave my friends a tour (I was late) and gave them some things to try, the service was spot on, refills without asking, never having to wait for our wait staff.  Then we were served a couple desserts for our friends birthday which were absolutely amazing. I can't get enough of this place. It's worth a visit or 10. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!  I wish more restaurants would take note from how Perch does business.

name: Crafted
address: 4900 Libbie Mill E Blvd, Richmond, VA 23230, USA
reviews: Service was excellent.  And the food was delicious. I didn't give 5 stars because I requested a "seasonal" cocktail that was not in season and they were unable to make.  But the seasonal cocktail i did order was very good! 3/4 of us at our table loved our meal! I recommend the pimento cheese for a starter, crab soup, the country pig salad, and the blackberry chop!!
Cute space, great staff, yummy food.  The staff were very helpful and attentive.  Food was good.  The Southern Gentleman burger is delicious and indulgent.  Biscuits are fluffy and soft.

Get the Lady Bird. Let me say it is the best chicken sandwich I’ve had in a long time. Cooked to perfection and the potato wedges were perfectly crisp. Staff is considerate and keeps a clean establishment. I will be coming back again and again for that sandwich!

Picked up lunch this week. Super friendly staff (Jaymie and Justin) quickly had my order perfect and the cold crowler ready to go. Definitely recommend the Beef n cheddar with wedges! That cheese sauce was da bomb! Got the Korean and dry rub wings; both were delicious. Love the draft list! Can’t wait to go back! New fave spot!

Great neighborhood kind of place with a variety of beers, wines, and mixed drinks. They have a kind-of bipolar menu with a $22 entree (which was very tasty), a couple of other entrees, then it drops to burgers (which I have not tried but looked delicious). I think this place is trying to find out who they are and will get there. My recommendation -- give it a try.

name: Chez Foushee
address: 2 E Grace St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: What an impeccable dinning option! They have never disappointed me. That's cuisine is artfully delivered and their specials are unique. I've found that while reservations are appreciated, they are able to accommodate walk-ins. It's been very crowded when I've been. The wait staff is very kind and welcoming.

Wow this place is great. The staff is on point and the food is excellent.  The omelette was superbly French complemented with perfectly seasoned crispy potatoes. I will be coming back next time I'm in town.

We went here for brunch and it was surprisingly empty. It’s a fancy restaurant and it was hard to chose from their tasty-sounding menu, but we ended up getting the crab Benedict and creme brûlée French toast.

The crab Benedict came with hash browns and fruit, and the French toast came with strawberries and whipped cream on top. Creme brûlée French toast was more like a pound cake though it made it more unique— it could function more as a dessert than an entree.

Crab Benedict had only a complete pieces of shell that I noticed, and the poached eggs on top we’re good. We also got some Rose tea (which had a fancy-sounding name). It was aromatic yet quite strong. 

Since we ‘checked-in’ using Yelp, we got two free truffle pieces. It is worth trying their brunch as they have some unique and good tasting menu items to choose from.

I am sorry guys I was so immersed in the food experience that I forgot to take any pictures... but this place does not need pictures to be described. Chez Foushee is by far one of my favorite places in Richmond. It wasn't just about the drinks and food but an overall amazing experience with the faint fragrance of lillies, interesting conversation with the bar tender, the beautifully decorated place and most importantly a perfectly cooked duck breast paired with the right wine.
Risotto with shrimp was delicious. I was there with 2 couples. Everyone was pleased with their meal and the service. A real plus was that it is not a loud restaurant.

name: Salt & Forge
address: 312 N 2nd St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: Was visiting with a friend in the city for the day. Plenty of space on a busy Saturday for a party of 5. The sandwiches were great, although the service might have been a tad slow but it was fine. Bathrooms were very clean as well. Nice interior design too. I would recommend. The BBQ chips are very good :)
Wonderful food. The owner is always there making sure the food comes out perfect. Love Salt and Forge for the biscuits and the care that’s out into every meal. If i could give 10 stars i would.

Amazing! Get the Ashville Chicken sandwich (the one in my pic). They open at 7 so they're perfect for breakfast, but also have extensive lunch/dinner options. I need to go back and try more of their menu. The service is friendly and it's a clean and happy environment!

This place is incredible, can't wait to come back! Their homemade biscuits are to die for. We got the bacon, egg and cheese and the sausage (house made!), egg and cheese. The tomato jam is a must! Thank you Adam and Melissa, your food is amazing!

Incredible food, perfect recipes, quality ingredients, generous portions, and exceptional customer service. I’m unsure of what else one could ask for in a restaurant, hence this spot has become a frequented favorite.

name: Nile
address: 306 N 29th St, Richmond, VA 23223, USA
reviews: Homestyle Ethiopian food prepared with skill; delicious and so good for you. Meatless and meat options are available on both starters and main courses with plenty of vegan choices. Can't decide? The sampler platter is a filling way to try it all! The space is small, with only a few tables, so come early, and expect not to hurry - the food is freshly prepared and meant to be enjoyed and experienced, not rushed through. Street parking is plentiful; do be aware the only bathroom is downstairs and not wheelchair accessible.

It was good. I an not a fan of the gluten free injera. Also this is in a gentrified area. I feel like the seasoning is catered to pallets in that area. While it was good. I've had better ethiopian in Richmond.
Traditional etheopian food, spicy and delicious! Was cooked right away, this is real food. Looking forward to going back in the future!

Fantastic family owned place! I was too excited about finding an Ethiopian restaurant, and utterly geeked out. The owner was calm, supportive, and (appropriately) mildly amused. 

They were INCREDIBLY understanding of my food allergy, and helped me navigate the menu.

I ordered dinner for my sister's family, then went back the next day for my own. 

Their injera is GLORIOUS!!!
We ordered the 2 meats combo platter with 3 veggies and also had the lamb (all pictured here). Everything was delicious! Service was great. Food was fresh.

name: Metzger Bar and Butchery
address: 801 N 23rd St, Richmond, VA 23223, USA
reviews: Food was delicious. So nice to see things that you don't find at other restaurants. For example, rabbit. Service was great. And it was great to see them taking extra care in cleaning during this trying time. Like cleaning the door handle at least 3 times while we were there for dinner.

Cozy place with very good food. If I remember correctly, the corkage fee was only $20. I love bringing my own wine to restaurants when I can. The charcuterie board was out of this world. Our server was delightful. I wish I could remember her name. 

Try to sit away from the door in the winter. It’s cold with a big draft when the door opens.  

My only complaint is that the menu changes often so if you find a dish you love (and you likely will) it may not be offered the next time you’re there.

Went with my girlfriend during Richmond restaurant week. The restaurant has an interesting aesthetic. It feels like an upscale bar/pub because of the small size. Service was terrific. They serve three course meals here and I had the Smoked Sweet Potato, Eggplant Schnitzel, and Apple Strudel. The Schnitzel was particularly delicious and was the highlight of the evening. Would recommend to others.

This is a fascinating place to eat! I had the chicken schnitzel Which is kind of like a country fried steak with gravy and fried eggs on duck fat fried potatoes underneath! It was a decadent brunch unlike any I have had!

Absolutely delightful brunch. Perfect dishes to share excellent mix of cocktails and beer.  Very authentic take on German and euro dining and a comfortable space. The cheese spaetzle with egg carried me back to my youth. Missed the pretzels but I'm sure they are delicious as well.

name: The Daily Kitchen & Bar
address: 2934 W Cary St, Richmond, VA 23221, USA
reviews:
This is my third time dining at The Daily. I always sit at the bar. I always get the fried calamari and a drink. Both have been amazing each time. 

The bartenders are always pleasant and well-informed about the menu, dietary restrictions, and available substitutions. They go out of their way to make me feel welcome and appreciated. That means a lot. That means that they care about their customer's experience.

Go here for dinner, lunch or brunch. You'll love it!

Delicious food but pretty darn pricey.
⭐️⭐️⭐️ Particularly because of cost & our service wasn’t great. We waited nearly an hour after ordering our food. Something definitely went awry but our waitress never said anything about it. Unfortunately we didn’t either so, maybe that’s our fault. 🤷🏻‍♀️
Unsure if I’ll go back even though it tasted good, just not sure that it’s really worth it for me.
If you like “finer things” and spending $$ then def hit this place up! You’ll probably like it better than I did. 
*Sandwiches are def the best bang for your buck
**Banana bread is also surprisingly delicious (my friend ordered it)

Hubby brought me brunch @ The Daily. Yum. The restaurant has a trendy vibe, the front of the house is decorated in a cool mix of organic meets clean lines. The  food came out hot. Our service was good. The back of the house was running smoothly as it did not take a long time to get our food.  My favorite part of the restaurant having enough room to have a private conversation in public.

The Daily Kitchen & Bar was a great experience. The organic food they serve here is delicious. The lime cilantro sauce was fantastic and made my spicy chicken avocado bowl, also was a good dip for the fried. Overall I will definitely go again to enjoy more of the delicious meals.
It's a little on the loud side when they are busy. Love the health options. Service was good. Food was just alright. But I didn't feel it was over priced.

name: Addis Restaurant
address: 9 N 17th St, Richmond, VA 23219, USA
reviews: Had a great lunch here. Really enjoyed it.

Delicious food, family style, authentic experience! Prices are fair for the quality and location. Highly recommend “all 6” vegetable options with one or two meats for a table of 4. We were stuffed! Can’t wait to come back!
Good food with great taste and quality. A single entree with an extra side should be good for two. Especially loved their minced chicken dish

Incredible. My wife and I have now eaten here around 10 times. Each time, we worry it won’t live up to how good it was previously. Each time, it’s as good or better. Quickly becoming my favorite place in the city. 

If you are unsure of what to order, do a specialty platter and ask for recommendations. You can’t go wrong.

Went there for my birthday. Food was amazing. Service was great. We had a party of 9, and even with a large group, everything went really smooth. Would highly suggest trying a little bit of everything. We did!

name: MOSAIC Restaurant
address: 6229-A River Rd, Richmond, VA 23229, USA
reviews: This was our first night out after having our daughter so we were very excited.  When we arrived a waitress helped us since the hostess (short haired female) was on the phone.  She attempted to sit us next to a large party so we asked if a booth was available. As she was looking the hostess was rudely shaking her head no and putting her hand in the air as if we were bothering her.  We finally just accepted the table by the party.  The food was average. Not bad, but nothing special.  Since we rarely go out we got drinks, apps, dinner, and dessert.  We were at the table approximately an hour and I had just paid my bill (maybe 5 minutes) before the hostess came over and said we needed to leave because she needed the table. This was just not a pleasant experience and considering we are blessed with multiple great restaurants all around Richmond we will not be heading back.  Go spend your money somewhere else.  Like Azzuro right next door.

Read until the end — Friendly service, and the food was OK. Though, there are two single occupancy restrooms. One of which has an “out of order” sign taped to the door. Unfortunately, this sign is misleading. The restroom works fine, the employees are just 
using it as their own private restroom..Smh.

Wasn't great, wasn't bad, just kind of mediocre.
There's no list of their draft beers, so you have to rely on the handwritten chalkboard on the wall (like you would find at a dive bar). I picked my beer off of the chalkboard, and my wife picked her wine off of the (printed) wine menu. They were out of both (so back to the chalkboard for me). Not a big deal, but having an accurate beverage listing on a Saturday night should be a given. The food was good, but that's about it (our waitress was great, I must add).
Maybe I'll try again, but not somewhere I'd go out of my way to eat or recommend.

This is the absolute worst experience I have ever encountered with a restaurant. I made a reservation for my family on Christmas Eve at 3:30 pm. When I got to the restaurant, we were informed that this was impossible as they closed at 3 pm. When I went to show them the confirmation, my Open Table said that it was for December 26 at the same time. They were extremely rude about it, basically shoving us out the door and telling us better luck next time. I figured it must have been my mistake, so I let it be and thankfully found another last minute reservation elsewhere. As you can see in my email confirmations, my reservation was originally for when I thought, but changed late the night before without so much as a phone call. I have been a host at many restaurants that use the same Open Table system and know it is not possible to completely move a reservation on the restaurant end without changing the amount of people. If they had simply called to let us know that they were closing early, rather than being sneaky, rude and unaccommodating leaving my family with no Christmas Eve reservations as far as they knew, that would have been much preferred. Even if this was my fault, which as the email confirmations show it was not, the absolute snottiness to my family was absurd. Due to this experience, I will not be returning to this restaurant, nor recommending it to anyone I know. If it were possible to post this with zero stars, that is what I would give them and their staff.

Visited this restaurant for a friend's birthday celebration. I arrived late and it took a very long time to be waited on.  It was a Monday evening and the place wasn't extremely packed but it appeared the waiter was also the server and bartender for the evening. I didn't find anything I was thrilled about on the menu and the prices were very expensive, so I just opted for a sangria. My friends ordered calamari for an appetizer which was pretty good, but there were no raves for their individual entrees.  One friend ordered what she thought was a loaded baked potato which came out as loaded mashed potatoes instead another friend had some type of pesto meatball which she was disappointed with as well.  The gratuity was already included with the tab.  Overall the space was a little tight inside, it had a nice eccentric atmosphere but I would not personally choose to visit again.

name: Gersi
address: 805 N Davis Ave, Richmond, VA 23220, USA
reviews: Hands down, absolutely the best service in RVS extremely welcoming from start to finish, literally every single member of the staff provided outstanding customer service. Drinks were good (varied selection), appetizers, entrees, and dessert were delicious. We'd tried a few times over the last 2 months to get in, but it just hadn't worked out, it was most certainly worth the wait! Reservations are definitely recommended, gets busy very quickly during peak hours.

All four of us loved Gersi.  Great drinks (not cheap) and an excellent menu with some entrees priced in the mid teens.   Risotto entree was great,  friend said the sea bass was the best he'd had.  Same story with the Bolognese and linguini with clams.  Place was packed and loud,  which seemed right for this Brooklyn based restaurant.  We'll be back for sure!

Great cozy spot with amazing Italian food - homemade pasta is so delicious - all The staff were very attentive and knowledgeable and super friendly we would totally go back here again and recommend all our friends to go out here for a great dinner in the fan.  so glad this place has come to our neighborhood!

We came on a Saturday night and though we quickly realized we should have made a reservation, we decided that the 1-1.5 hour wait was worth it and we would wait. We waited and waited and checked back an hour and 45 min later (they said they’d call and they never did to update us) only to be told we still had another 20-30 minutes and they couldn’t guarantee us a spot because they “only seat reservations”. After explaining to the hostess and who appeared to be a manager that I understand they can’t predict timing of parties leaving, it would have been nice to know they seat reservations and they book out 2 days ahead so the likelihood of getting a table before 9 pm was almost zero. At this point it was 8:50 pm and we left to go to Mama Zu’s which has never left us disappointed and we got in immediately. I’m all for reservations but it should be made clear that they book their restaurant out with reservations instead of leaving tables for walk-ins. This situation would have been much better and I honestly wouldn’t write the review if it wasn’t for the way the manager talked to me and was incredibly rude talking to me like I was dumb and should be grateful they’d eventually seat us. Like you’re less than the people who made reservations. If that’s how you want to do business I’m fine with spending my money elsewhere. Also my friend wrote a review for this place and we had a terrible experience back in early November and they said they’d reimburse us for the food because of how awful the time was there and they never did which is incredibly annoying to be promised something by a business and then never follow through. Don’t come here without a reservation. It’s a waste of time and they’re rude. Maybe Gersi should explain that reservations are the only option on the weekend. That’s fine, but don’t tell us we’ll get a table you can’t guarantee, and don’t be rude.
Beautiful atmosphere and amazing food! Great place for a romantic evening. Will definitely come back

name: Bottoms Up Pizza
address: 1700 Dock St, Richmond, VA 23223, USA
reviews: We celebrated my son's birthday there tonight. Great food and a great time. Our waiter Jesse gave us wonderful service and Nick (manager) made sure my son's night was special!

the first time I was here was in 2001 and remembered it to be the best tasting pizza ever. What stuck out was the crust. The texture and the flavor. I have always talked about it through the years. I almost never find myself in Richmond but have always dreamt of going there when I was in Richmond. After waiting for many years, decided to make a special trip out there since I had a complete free day with no commitments. Taking advantage of this rarity I drove the 2 hours to try it. My waitress Grace was very friendly and suggestive of pies to try. Did the Smokehouse and the Chesapeake and both were FANTASTIC! It still hold the record of my most favorite pizza place
Great pizza, love the crust! Haven't had one I didn't like. Salads good too.

My 2nd time here and I can only say it is perfect! Pizza was delicious and 1 slice is so big I had to take half of it home. Finding a parking spot can be a bit tricky, but once you solve that, the experience is worth it. Server was a brand new employee but did a great job. When done eating, you can take advantage of their great location and walk to Main Station, Farmers Market and many other wonderful places around. Delicious Pizza, good service, great price. 5 Stars indeed! Thanks!

Well made pizza. We liked the thin crust more than the regular. We had the crab with white sauce & brisket with bbq sauce pizzas. Unique flavors done well. We ordered mediums- they were definitely bigger than typical individual sized pizzas but seemed little smaller than a typical medium size.
